description: A good dive bar with a solid beer selection and more room than you'd think (the back is kinda wide). Look out for a very friendly chihuahua mix named Whiskey Tenderloin. He is excellent and, I think, there quite often.
author: Misha T.

description:
I wasn't expecting Whiskey Thieves to be a dive bar going in, but I didn't mind. It was on the nicer end as a dive bar, the place was very clean! Pretty much the only thing divey about it was the random pool table in the back of the room and the dark ambiance. We came here early afternoon on a Saturday, so it wasn't busy at all. The bartender was nice enough, but he wasn't especially personable. Surprisingly for a place with "Whiskey" in its name, this place didn't actually have that extensive of a whiskey list, so that was the disappointing part... But the prices for the drinks we did end up getting were very reasonable! 

For the reasonable prices, I can see myself coming back here, but at the same time it is also out of the way and may not be worth the hassle.
author: Evelynn C.

description: Dive bar, dirty and not very nice. Walked in and walked back out. Won't be going back.
author: Patrick W.

description:
After dinner, an old college friend and I wanted more whiskey. After yelping nearby places, I found Whiskey Thieves. I've had this place bookmarked for some time, so we made the walk from the Financial District to the Tenderloin. We got here on Thursday, July 14th around 8:45pm.

This place is divey, but I kind of loved it. They had a good selection of bourbon, rye, whiskey, and beer. I just let my friend order while I found a table. Ended up finding a small table past the bar to the right. My friend got us shots of bourbon (?) and a brown ale. It was nice sipping on both while catching up. We hadn't hung out, just the two of us in years, so we had a lot of catching up to do. Whiskey Thieves has a jukebox and the music can get a little loud, but we were still able to have a conversation.

Nice laid back bar. They have a pool table as well if you'd like to play a game. Plus, I adore the name!
author: Elena N.

description:
3.5 Stars

Can't go wrong with $6 PBR tall can and shot of Jameson 
Pool table in the back with a decent amount of seating for large groups
Definitely more of a dive bar feeling 

Overall Thoughts

A solid bar stop but nothing noteworthy to jump it up another notch
author: Eddie W.

description:
Sweet dive bar - I dig it.

I'm not that into watching  sports, but I came here twice with friends to watch the Warriors game (during finals too) because they serve good whiskey and it's not ridiculously crowded like the other bars. In fact you may even get a seat, sir.

Pours? Not stingy.
Cost? Fair for downtown SF. I know other bars serve more selection, but factoring in base prices, selection, and pour sizes I think these guys do it right.
Ambience? Like a dive bar - pool table and pinball machine, but will serve you better drinks than your average dive. Not pretentious at all like many bars and whiskey joints.
Whisk(e)y selection? Changes up every time and has a decent selection of bourbon, rye, and scotch.

Bonuses: There are beer options and maybe other liquor options if you don't like whiskey (but why????). All the bartenders here have been helpful and nice. If you want to decide between a a couple whiskeys, they will usually let you have a tiny taste.
author: Joanne Y.

description:
This whiskey girl has finally stumbled upon her favorite whiskey bar!! I'm not a whiskey connoisseur, so the bartender Jamie was super helpful in helping me to decide which types of scotch I would like. Turns out my favorite so far is Great King St.

Anyways, the whiskey selection here is impressive. They also have a few good beers on tap in case you want a change of scene. And I always love where there is a pool table in the back of the bar. Will be coming here more often!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Several people gathered in front of the door to smoke, only one bother to move aside to let us in the door. My friend ordered a Sierra, which they were out of and I ordered a Pacifico, which he told me they were also out of. Only 4 or 5 people (all male) in the entire bar in a Thursday night, I wouldn't recommend this bar.
author: Andrea M.

description:
A pretty cool bar that we found by accident when walking back to our residency. As the name suggests, there is a lot of Whisk(e)y so Bourbon, Scotch etc. They also serve bottled beer and got several further brands on tap. 
The barman or should I say barmen were pretty cool as we got served by different ones and knew their whisk(e)y quite well (if you keep asking yourself, why I keep writing that word with an "e" in parenthesis - well, go there and let yourself be educated. Also why it is called bourbon or scotch as those guys know their shit. I can tell you, though, that it has to do with the country of origin and certain regulations to follow when producing the liquor)
Anyhow, I let myself be distracted. We had some nice beer and whisky and had a good time. The prices there are okay I think, you can pay a loooooot for a small glass of whisk(e)y but good brands are expensive. Overall, we liked it very much and the atmosphere was cool, in the background of the bar all the varieties of the whisk(e)y they sell are presented. Looks very nice!!
author: Hannes M.

description:
How appropriate to start off Whiskey Wednesday with a review about a whiskey bar. 

One of the better bar I went to on my trip to SF. $5 boiler makers, nuff said. Hahaha
I think we had Jameson and PBR, but my friend said we had bullit rye. Whatever it was...it was a good deal. Before 5pm or something its only $5. It was the obvious decision to take up this deal at 11am on a Sunday  #daydrinking.

Came in here with fellow yelper elites Tara C. aka the instigator, Dave D. and Marcus L. Little did Tara know, I don't turn down for NUTHIN' #turndownforwhat.
So she offer to buy me a boiler maker if I take one with her. We were all suppose to just have a shot of whiskey and a tall boy PBR. But I walked out with 1 shot of whiskey and 3 tall boys, Tara and Dave ended having 1 shot and followed by a Double shot HAHAHA. I called those double shot(but it was a single), because the bartender had a heavy pure(I aint mad at chya), and is super cool. Left him a nice tip. 

Shout out to the nice people with the shrimp cocktails playing scrabbles. You guys are the best. I hope you guys read this, I'll be back. You have my word.

PS. Tara and Dave were SMASHED for the rest of the day/night :)
author: Jackson Y.

description:
This has got to be one of the coolest little places (bars) we have found since moving to San Francisco area 5 months ago. David, our bartender was so cool and down to earth. The Johnny Walker Platinum was pretty good too. Great prices, dicey place, just off of Geary, but very nice people and fun place. 

Only downside: Bathrooms are horrendous. Stinky and dirty. Don't sit down. lol

But, that being said, we will be back. :)
author: Tanya C.

description: More like a dive bar with bad selection of beers such as high life! There is a nice pool table but the crowd and the overall atmosphere is pretty ghetto.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
If you like your whiskey neat, you're in for quite a treat.

As the name implies, this dive bar has got quite a stock of whiskey, along with funky music, a pinball machine, and a pool table.

My friend got the special listed outside: $7 for a tall PBR + shot of some random shitty whiskey, which I drank most of--let that go in the books, HA. My poor liver boohoo.

I got the $8 KENTUCKY MULE, a bourbon mule made with Bulleit bourbon (the whiskey of mixed drinks and a step-down from Jameson, which my friend told me is the lowest of the higher grade whiskeys), lime juice, ginger beer, and a wedge of lime. Cheap and tasty, but I'm still more partial to creative cocktails, no surprise there.

CASH ONLY.
author: Adele F.

description:
What the hell else am i gonna do when I'm on crutches other than play pool, look at fun/weird art and drink my pain away?

Nice bartenders, nice people in the bar (feels like a neighborhood bar) and has a great selection of whiskey with a nice bartender that gives recommendations based on what his favorites are. There is nothing I don't like about this place.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
Divey place, but it was comfortable. We came over here after a fabulous dinner to kill some of the later hours of the evening, and it was great. We weren't so sure we were going to fit in well when we first walked through the door, but we ended up enjoying it. I tried the Radeberger brew and I really enjoyed it. I couldn't understand why it was cash only, unless maybe their credit card machine was taking the day off.

The bartender was awesome and chatted with us pretty much the entire time we were there. We ended up fitting right in with the crowd there and no one batted an eye at us. The restrooms were a little uhmmm ... dirty?

Overall we enjoyed our time here, I'd definitely come back again.
author: Dane T.

description: I love this place. It can be chilly in here in the wintertime, so you have to keep drinking whiskey just to stay toasty and they have a great variety to warm your cockles. I love sidling up to the old wood bar where I can always get a seat, but it's never empty. When I'm feeling fancy I'll have a High West "Rendezvous rye" old fashioned, but they have a fantastic deal - $7 PBR+shot (often of Bulleit Boubon) which I do every time I'm there. It's dark, and old and serious about just drinking. And there are hand-painted murals on the walls which gives it a special local touch. The bartenders are focused yet friendly. There's a good bar pool table I always try to convince my friend to play with me on, and I just love this place so damn much. Best dive bar in the area. Divey without being gross. Just come here to drink and hang with friends. And there's cheap, just passable pizza on the same block to feed your cravings when you need a little snack. So just come on over and meet me here sometime. They've got a pool cue waiting for you.
author: David A R.

description:
Oh, the joy of finding a whiskey bar with a truly impressive collection of single malts, bourbons, ryes and et cetera whiskeys.

Here is a place, if you are fortunate to find yourself in the vicinity on a regular basis, where, under the tutelage/sage advice of a friendly, knowledgeable bartender, explore the mysteries of the various afore-mentioned spirits.   You can learn about a broad variety of whiskies and not abuse your taste buds in the process.

I recommend getting there and sitting at the bar where you can see all the grand variety of labels on the shelves.   If you bring a friend or two, you can share tastes from shots and be able to try a good number of them without getting snookered.

The atmosphere is dark, cool, and inviting.   

I highly recommend a visit if you like whiskey, or want to learn how to like whiskey (Best way, start with a good one and don't go through the horrible experience of drinking blended rotgut.)
author: Candace Y.

description:
This is my kind of bar. It's a dive bar in the tenderloin with shelves of Scotch, Irish Whisky, Bourbon, Rye. There's a decent beer selection too. If you're looking for something other than Whiskey, you should probably go somewhere else.

The bartenders were really nice and gave us some tastes of thing. It was about $15-25 for some good quality stuff so it wasn't cheap but it's fun to be somewhere you can try different whiskies.

No credit cards. ATM inside.
author: Ryan L.

description: People talk highly about this spot and I just didn't understand why. The place is divey, which is great, I love a dive bar but the selection of liquor was not what I expected. The way people talk about this spot is like it's got some great selection and the drinks are amazing. They don't and they weren't!
author: Sarah S.

description: There really isn't much to say positive or negative. Decent selection of whiskey and divey; usually not too crowded. Great for an embarrassing date that you don't want to go anywhere but to bed..the lighting is really horrible. One plus is the pool table and pin ball machine, if they work. The bartenders are usually friendly but sorta limited in their mixology. Flavorful TL locals are usually lurking near too.
author: Sabrina D.

description:
Ambience: 4/5 I love dive bars like this. Pool table, graffiti, weird art. I likey 
Service: 5/5 Bartender was super friendly and willing to offer suggestions when requested.
Drinks: 4/5 Small whisky selection, but a few good quality drinks at a reasonable price. 
Tidbit: Name is because the owner, Paul, was once fired for "stealing". He has opened 3 bars with "thieve" in the name. " Don't get mad, get even". I love it!
author: Ryan S.

description: 2 stars would be kind to the kind of experience this place gave. We walk in expecting it to be full of life and and guy at the door was smoking a cigarette and gave us a look saying he'll be right in. He was the bartender, smoking, right in front of the door. It didn't take us long to realize why it was so dead inside. It smell of rotting old people and cigarettes. I came to play pool but didn't even want to stand there for much longer. Not a great selection of whiskey either.
author: Riya F.

description:
I came to Whiskey Thieves when they had almost no whiskey. Seriously.

Or, at least they were out of the cheap and good stuff - no Bulleit, no Four Roses, etc.. They claimed to have been cleaned out the previous today. Weird.

The bartenders were extremely friendly, though - talked through a couple of options and ended up making my wife a Manhattan with Jameson (ended up tasting better than anyone expected!). I opted for a PBR and a Jameson. Nice.

The interior is pretty standard for a nice-divey place.

I'd try this place again, hoping for a more full menu.
author: Bill H.

description: Ummmm....not sure why this place is 4stars?!? It's a serious dive bar, which I typically like, but there's a difference between dive & awful. I ordered a Greyhound and the bartender asked me what kind of gin I wanted- huh??! My husband ordered a Rye manhattan and the bartender asked him if he wanted whiskey?!? What kind of place is this? The drinks were awful and I don't understand how anyone could mess up a Greyhound! In closing I will share with you what the bartender told another patron-- he expressed his frustrations that someone ordered some weird sparkling Chardonnay in mini bottles. What bartender doesn't know the difference between champagne and Chardonnay? On that note, we left!! Pass on this place!
author: Sarah G.

description: Great little dive bar!  Service was awesome and drinks were perfect! The bartender made me a legit old fashioned, that wasn't filled with sugar and tasted strong (just how I like my men ;)). I saw they also had Not Your Fathers Root Beer which I have never tried. Upon asking the bartender, he suggested we go next door and get a scoop of ice cream and he will pour the beer over it. An adult root beer float!! It was raining and cold, but we'd be dumb not to. It was amazing! This bar was totally up my alley, not too crowded and great whiskey.
author: Sandi S.

description: My best friend taught me to sip whiskey here. The bartender Brandan was really great!
author: Tatiana J.

description: More good customer service in the TL!  Gotta love a dive bar with no attitude in SF.
author: SF T.

description:
I live a couple blocks away and I still rarely come here.

The prices are not as great as the whiskey selection. There are a lot of great pours here, but you'll shell out for them.

The place gets annoyingly crowded, service is slow, and it's cash only.

I've had great nights here, but they've all been IN SPITE OF these factors, rather than BECAUSE OF them.

Still, there are a lot of great whiskies, so I won't fault them on that count.

YMMV
author: Harley C.

description:
This DIVE BAR has a great section of scotch 

Cons:
- it's 2014 and it's cash only
-it's a dive bar, so it's not exactly clean
- being in the TL, you get all sorts of people.....

Pros:
- great selection of scotch 

I had a good time. Will I be back? No.
author: Angelica C.

description:
Note: Do not come here if you don't like whiskey. Duh.

Whiskey Thieves is the one place I've ever gone that, when the bartender asks you what you'd like, and you say "I don't know," they don't give you the stink eye and treat you like some underage kid who's never been to a bar before. Instead, they ask you what you usually drink, and they allow you to try a few of their awesome whiskeys before buying one. This is a great place for trying new things. I've tried many varieties of whiskey that I've never even heard of before. Mmm. Whiskey.

The one bummer: it's cash only. Oh well.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Nice bartenders truly make a bar.

The bartenders here are unbelievably personable.

We came in here wanting to play a mellow game of pool and Whiskey Thieves was ideal.

No one was playing on the pool table - and for just four quarters we were able to have a fun casual game without having to worry about bumping anyone with our pool cues. The bathrooms aren't exactly the cleanest - but there was no line and in a matter of minutes it went from having no amenities - to being fully stocked. Their bar staff are obviously on it.

And later on in the evening - one of their bartenders came up to us and gave us four quarters -  which had been forgotten at the bar. His genuine smile and outgoing charm made me realize why Whiskey Thieves despite it's bizarre wall deco - is a neighborhood destination.

I would definitely return.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I thought I was going to get shanked on my way here from the Civic BART station, but made it here in one piece. Visited this bar for an away game for my 9-ball APA league team. It didn't long for me to get the bartenders attention. It wasn't too busy inside for a Monday night. I decided to get a Manhattan since this bar's specialty is Whiskey. It was actually sippable, not overly stiff, but just enough for my liking. The pool table is nice but unlike most other bars I played in for league night, you actually have to put quarters in. Last, but not least, the jukebox has an excellent selection especially if you like Wu-Tang clan or any of their members like Raekwon.

Overall a laidback bar in the TL. I saw someone wearing a suit inside, but it's more of a white t-shirt/hoodies/jeans type of placr.
author: Gerard Y.

description: After a long flight from the East Coast I was looking for a decent Manhattan near my hotel.  You wouldn't think it by looking at the place, but Whiskey Thieves fit the bill.  Friendly bartenders, fantastic whiskey selection, excellent cocktails and a cozy neighborhood feel. Don't feel intimidated - drop by, check it out and have a cocktail - am sure a regular will strike up a conversation with you.
author: Rich R.

description:
Whiskey Thieves is an absolute Mecca for hipsters. Each night hipsters across San Francisco put on their flannel shirts, comb their beards, and head here to sample the array of whiskeys and bourbons. 

If you see a hipster outside the Mission on a Saturday night chances are they are headed to Whiskey Thieves. Where else can you get a shot of you've-never-heard-of-it-but-I-have-bourbon and a tall can of PBR for 7 dollars? If you want someone to give you unsolicited advice on what to order, or even worse, a lengthy explanation on the differences between bourbon and whiskey then you've definitely come to the right place. 

The nice thing is Whiskey Thieves is rarely crowded, which means you can sit back and observe the hipster lifestyle in relative comfort, just don't ever confuse a whiskey for a bourbon... they'll have your head for that.
author: Tom L.

description: This was stop number 2 from our one night bar hopping adventure in San Francisco this weekend, and it was pretty cool. It wasn't that crowded to be honest, but we didn't mind, getting a pint of pbr with a shot of Jameson for 7 bucks was fine by us! This place looks cool to go with a group of friends before heading out to the final bar, nice dive bar.
author: Miguel R.

description:
Awesome whiskey awesome bartender. They have a ton of delicious whiskey and the bartender is super helpful if you don't know what you want. 

It's a small place located off of Geary and it's rad. There is a pool table a long bar and really cool art work.
author: Amy A.

description:
Delicious whiskey! Friendly, fun, knowledgeable bartenders!

Did I mention the delicious whiskey?!

If you are me, you WILL end up hungover!

Your challenge, if you choose to accept it, is delicious whiskey!

Minus one star/a line without an exclamation point for cash only.
author: Vivienne P.

description: A wide whiskey selection, but there are better choices in the area if you're looking for mixed drinks (not just shots and whiskey neat/on the rocks).
author: David S.

description: Divey-ish bar with really awesome bar tenders. Cheap drinks and pool in the back. Single person bathrooms. They have a juke box. No grey goose, but they have kettle. boohoo.
author: Christine L.

description: As soon as me and my girlfriend sit down we are greeted by the bartender who is a friendly. She tells us about the 7$ pbr tall can and shot special which we get. Didn't stay too long but patrons seemed to come in slowly as time passed. Nice little bar. Kinda on the divey side but not bad. Cash only I believe
author: Joe M.

description: The only ones in there on a Thursday afternoon! Got to play pool with the BF and watched him kick my butt twice! I guess beginner's luck ran out! The bartender was talkative and suggested some great whiskey to try out. Both of us enjoyed the Irish Whiskey he recommended. A great stop for a quick drink on a sunny afternoon!
author: Angelie D.

description: Love it. Great locals place. Talked to some interesting people here and always had great service. Will return next time I am in San Fran.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Pretty cool place to start your night or meet up with a friend to hang out. It's dark and the bar is fully stocked.

Cash only.
author: Christina L.

description:
I don't know if it's cuz christmas is in two weeks or if this place is always like this, but I couldn't stand 3 min in the place as I was lost among the drunk Santas everwhere. It was wayyy too crowded and smelt like rancid beer and it wasn't even 6 PM yet!! Sorry.. but ewww.

Update: a few hours later I tried again and had a terrible  experience right outside. The bartenders don't seem to care how drunk the customers are, which actually put my safety in jeopardy. I will never return.
author: Cimmone F.

description:
Super dive-y!

What's up with your sign Whiskey Thieves? I could hardly see any type of signage to find this place. 

Their Whiskey was on point though, they also had a good selection of craft beer. If you're into drinking Old Style and PBR then this place is for you. Everyone could use a break from IPA and stouts every now and then... haha!

Damn, your bathrooms are grimy as F%^*!  I suppose this defines the bar's character. You should go elsewhere if you can't handle bathrooms heavily decorated with graffiti. BYOTP = bring your own toilet paper just in case...
author: Keith O.

description:
5 stars all the way for this baby!

We stumbled inside late Tuesday on the hopes that it would relieve our SFSOB/Infusion sickness.  Whiskey Thieves was the perfect antidote.

Their collection of whiskeys is unbelievable, and they also offer a variety of beers for the softer drinkers in life.  I happily sipped the rest of the night away on an Anchor Summer.  Yummy, and perfectly priced to boot!  (Thanks MD for my lovely beer)

S_ had their daily special, which consisted of a shooter and an Amstel Light chaser.  Sounds crazy, right?  I can't remember what MD had, but it looked good too.

The best part was the jukebox.  It takes credit cards, even though there's an ATM machine inside.  I happily threw down $5 for 17 credits, and only got to hear 2 of the songs I chose.  But they made me happy.  So much better than the crap we have to deal with on a weekly basis at Infusion.  And the crowd in the bar singing Pour Some Sugar On Me with me made me even happier.  I gladly left 9 credits on the box for whomever wanted to hear more stuff after I left.

I wanna go back and get fracked on whiskey and beer.  Come join me.
author: Lorrayne L.

description:
1)  Quinn is a terrific bartender

2)  Great selection, free advice & tasting 

3)  Hidden in a crappy neighborhood, so no hipsters, and not precious or pretentious
author: Mark J.

description:
CASH ONLY!!

Small bar with a lot of character.  Came here on a Saturday night and ordered Bullet Ginger for only $6.  What?? I found my whiskey heaven.
author: Tammy N.

description: Great prices, great whiskey, not too crowded, and a bartender who manages to work alone on Halloween and still sling fast, delicious drinks out with barely a wait. Love it.
author: Bethany H.

description:
3.5 I'd say.

I mainly like this place because of their friendly pet white pitbull.  A bar pet is peculiar and unusual.  The place is dive-y and was emptier than I had expected it to be.  The walls are full of graffiti and some random Vietnamese looking women art and there are pool tables and a small sticky bathroom in the back corner.  

They serve you even if you're a dude with no shirt on.
author: Brenda L.

description:
God I love this place. From the amazing selection of whiskies and the great bartenders to the overall ambience, this place feels like it was made just for me. Sure, the bathroom reeks, but if it didn't the place just wouldn't feel right. 

Last time I came here, I found out that they didn't have a bottle of my favorite bourbon (Blanton's) handy. I asked the bartender to recommend one, and he let me taste three different bourbons all within my price range so I could find one I really liked. The bartender knew a lot about every whisky on the shelves, and even bought the beer on my order as well. By the way, Old Blowhard is a great bourbon. 

This is the type of place I wish I could spend hours and $200 in, and given the time or money I definitely would.
author: Eric L.

description:
Thievery indeed happened here and it wasn't in the form of me stealing the bartenders' hearts. No, no, no. I was robbed of some choice beers (though I found myself sipping away on Chimay all night long so it wasn't all bad) which wouldn't have mattered in the very least but apparently as we were leaving the bar (that was pretty dead on a Thursday evening) the bartender told me that they did have the beers I asked for they just didn't want to serve them to me. I am especially surprised by this because I thought he and I had built a great rapport when I was ordering drinks. Not sure what that's all about, but like any good criminal, he got away with it.

Probably wouldn't be too quick to post up there again when in town.
author: Katie B.

description:
This bar is amazing. So welcoming and helpful was the bartender that I kind of forgot that I was in the city to be honest.

My friend and I checked out Whiskey Thieves on Saturday night. The bartender was amazing, super friendly and attentive. When we were deciding what kind of whiskey to have in our drinks and were obviously undecided she gave us a tasting of 5 different whiskies so we could make our choice. I couldn't believe the generosity.

After about 20 minutes we chose our whiskey and she made us the most amazing whiskey sours. Heavy on the whiskey and not too sweet, just like I like 'em. Two drinks for $16 which in the city is a steal. 

The best part was this woman obviously knew her whiskey and chatted with me at length about the different brands and flavors..it was awesome. I don't often come across another woman who shares such a love of this amazing nectar. Glad to know I'm not the only female whiskey lover out there.

Great spot to hang out and have a good drink in a chill unpretentious environment. I am officially a fan!
author: Jenny B.

description: Came here on a Saturday night. There was a good trickle of people, but it wasn't overly crowded, which was really  nice because we got to talk to the bartenders, who are equally awesome. They know all about whiskey and can tell you neat stories about Prohibition, the whiskey process, and whatever else! Laid back joint with good booze and drinks. My one request, and perhaps I'm being snooty, but please get REAL brandied cherries for your manhattans vs. the maraschinos! it makes such a difference!
author: Zara S.

description:
The atmosphere is very dive-like yet offers a great selection of whisky. 

I was hopeful since I was stumbling on gold in a less-than-great neighborhood. I was expecting that the bartender would be more knowledgable than she was (or was it that she was more concerned about flirting with patrons?) We came here on a weeknight, fairly early after seeing a movie. Normally when you enter a not very busy establishment, the staff tends to take a little more notice that you're waiting. Bartender on shift this night? Forget it. Once we got her attention and ordered a drink, it was over-poured with liquor and not even sure she had added the proper measures of the mixer. But I'd expect if I order something specific, and you don't know how to make, tell me and I can change my order instead of getting a gross drink.

Prices are decent. I like the atmosphere and will definitely be back despite the poor service. Would definitely enjoy trying again.
author: Lauren A.

description:
The bf and I were in the area for a concert and we passed by Whiskey Thieves. We had about an hour to kill before the show started, so why not?

Yes, they have a lot of whiskey. I have never seen so many varieties of Jim Beam in my life. 

If you know me, then you know I'm not a drinker. However, my boyfriend is a connoisseur for a fine Kentucky Bourbon. The bartenders seemed kind of aloof for a while and not very talkative.  Maybe it's because I asked for a Pepsi and sat at the bar with no liquor. Who knows.

They poured the bf a little sample of some random whiskey as conversation was struck, but nevertheless, he was back to his usual favorites. 

Kind of expensive imho, but I'm cheap, so what do I know about prices in the city? I pretty much think any shot over $10 bucks is pricey, so maybe I'm not a good person to ask.

Bonus points because they have Bulliet and the bf is fond of it and that particular brand seems to be somewhat obscure at bars. 

Not a lot for a non-drinker to do here, other than watch people drink. The pool table was occupied, and it was too dark to really see clearly anyways. Ho-hum.
author: Grace Y.

description:
The male bartender is extremely rude.   I don't know what he thinks of himself.  I will definitely never return to this spot again., and would advise you to stay away as well.

If you want to be treated like a HuMan, go somewhere else!
author: Akshat K.

description:
Awesome things that happened at Whiskey Thieves on a Saturday night:

+I realized I want to be the cheeky bartender's best friend; Jenna, is it? The one who silently curses people who ask for anything but a shot or a beer; the one who's got the mouth of a sailor; the one who seems like she's been called "bitch" a few thousand times, but can brush off the comment and throw a snappy comeback faster than you can take that shot of Jager... AND it'll make you cry.

+I ordered a PB+J (tallboy of Pabst + a shot of Jameson) for $7 and was offered a free shot because... well, because see #1.

+The patron sitting beside me decided to divulge her need for, ahem, relations with her date. Apparently, he had yet to make a move on her and she wanted nothing more than to "get hers" that night, if ya know what I mean. So, my date and I devised various plans of action to help get that moving along, including monitoring their body language and facial positioning. We're creepy nerds, I know.

+This other couple standing up against the wall were the human form of the couple from the Pixar movie, "Up" (the young version). They were kinda dorky and super adorable. At some point, however, they were making out and it looked so awkward that I immediately thought of Virgin Diaries (they were kind of eating each other, not kissing each other) and then worried about their well being. I believe I turned to my date and gasped, "Gross! The nerds are kissing!" Not my most glamorous moment, I admit.

+By the time I turned to my randy friend who was on a date, they were gone. Godspeed, li'l lascivious lady. Hope you got yours.
author: Adena B.

description:
A great dive bar. These guys know their whiskey and give quite generously proportioned drinks for 7 bucks. The location is a little sketch, for which I'm thankful, as this keeps the crowd away.

Try their old fashioned. Ask for whiskey recommendations, their shelves are overflowing with obscure brands and never heard of flavors. 

Don't know what to get? Ask to taste. Perfectly free.

Try their whiskey sour. Absolutely delicious
author: Shan S.

description:
In Gone with the Wind, Clark Gable said, "With enough courage, you can do without a reputation." 

If your courage reserves are tapped out, you can take the cheater's shortcut and get bladdered up with liquor instead. 

You could do a lot worse than Whiskey Thieves, if you are going to imbibe some liquid courage. During the week, especially, it is quite possible to play a game of pool on the one table, get a seat at the bar, enjoy your company, and find a knowledgeable and kind whiskey mentor! 

There's been times when I passed my whiskey threshold, and may or may not have made out with some random unemployed hipster with a flannel shirt, or danced with a cue stick, but that's all part of doing without a reputation, right? I mean, there's no shame to be had when you don't remember what you did, eh?

But recently, I've toned it down, and do enjoy a nice, peaty whiskey or two while catching up with a friend at the bar. And besides, a little courage is needed for the winter of our discontent and the disconcerting walk in the Tenderloin.

Don't get too close! I have a cue stick, and I know how to use it!
author: Joanna M.

description:
This place really surprised me in a variety of ways. I kind of expected a more serious whiskey lounge decor...and it was just typical dive bar. Oh well.

The drinks are super cheap - $6 for a whiskey sour. My friends got their drinks from one bartender who made took the time and care to make them, and made super heavy on the whiskey. I ordered from another bartender...and he pretty much was like...you're a girl, I'm going to make your drink light on the whiskey and just mostly sour mix.....

Now usually I'd be pretty upset about this but I was looking for a lighter drink anyways so it worked. Plus now I know which bartender to ask if I want it harder on the booze.
author: Rowena L.

description:
Joseph! Cool bartender!!!
He spent some time going over a scotch or whiskey I might like. Great selection and super cool vibe!
author: Rick U.

description:
I love the whiskey and scotch selection at this place, and the bartenders are always very helpful and knowledgeable; but I'm just not as into the atmosphere here as I could be. 

It's not the divey feel that's the problem, I rather like that; it's more that the place almost always seems to have the feel of a frat house. It's so loud most nights that a conversation is impossible, even when it's mostly empty. Plus the jukebox always seems to be taken over by someone playing "ironic" music, like '80's hairband stuff. One or two of that kind of thing is funny, but when you're playing it for hours it gets old. Especially at a whiskey bar. To me whiskey is for talking or brooding, not head banging. 

It's a weird vibe, but if you're into a divey hipster space; the drinks are cheap and the bartenders are cool. Go for it.
author: Lynn B.

description:
I totally miss this place...

Great bar staff....quite funny.

If you like dive bars....this is the place to go....if you want frou frou drinks and comfy seats...then don't even bother coming here...
author: Koko K.

description:
Omg I love Whiskey Thieves!

$7 whiskey shot and tall boy of PBR is the way to go. If you enjoy hating life in the morning. Which, lucky for me, I DO!
author: Emily D.

description:
Great spot and excellent selection. I really appreciate the fact that they help you decide which whiskey you want to buy, and graciously offer a bunch of tastes to help you figure it out! That was awesome.

The divey ness was a bit meh, the area is not the greatest and I was meeting a friend there (a female, on her own) and insisted in meeting her somewhere else and walking together... It's not the most awesome of neighborhoods. Not a ton of seating either and cash only was not a super setup.

But the whiskey is great and the selection is fantastic. Prices are good especially given the stellar amount of free tastes.
author: Mike J.

description: Nice neighborhood spot. Great bartenders that are knowledgable about the whiskey/bourbons/rye they serve. Great prices and generous pours! Lively crowd that can border on rowdy at times though. Have to sometimes walk through a plum of smoke to get in. Not a fancy cocktail bar but low-key, divey place w/pool tables.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Thievery.

One simple history: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_8TTxGRhXWk

Another simple history: Extensive selection. Unpretentious vibe. Knowledgeable and friendly bartenders. Tough decision making. 

Two drinks were ordered. One a high quality whiskey for sipping. The other a recommended cocktail. Lost in conversation they soon were finished.

Billiards beckoned but we never made it. We might have finished our drinks, but I'm not finished with this place. Games to play. Drinks to try. Thievery to enjoy.
author: Jason B.

description:
Amazing place to try some new whiskey. The bartenders are amazing and super knowledgeable. I went in knowing very little about whiskey and what type I might enjoy. I asked the bartender for some recommendations. He brought me a variety and gave me full descriptions..He let me taste at least 5 different whiskeys before I made a decision. I felt like I was wine tasting!  It was a fantastic experience overall and I'll be back again soon.  

I highly recommend checking this place out!
author: Vanessa G.

description:
Witnessed my first bar fight here.. yikes. Thankfully, it was after I had taken my shot and nearly done with my beer. ($7 special, shot of Jameson and a Pabst!) The bartenders here were great and treated my friends like SF locals. Didn't try to overcharge and we're real easy to talk too. 

The place as a whole had that SF feeling to it. Graffiti was all over the walls and nice beats were playing in the background. If the fight hadn't of broken out I would've loved this place.. but by the end I witnessed one of the bartenders go from sweet to sour. Super FEISTY and wooooo she turned hood almost instantly. The cops that showed up did absolutely nothing, and that's why the bartender deserves a standing ovation. She protected what was hers and she did a damn good job. 

Visit this bar and give it a chance. Try the special and challenge someone to a game of pool.
author: Shelly M.

description:
I've been wanting to check out this place for a while now just because of the name.

I was sort of expecting a classy joint that had racks of whiskey. When I was there, it didn't really seem like that but they obviously served whiskey. I got the shot of Jameson and PBR for $7.

I mean, it's a straight up dive bar with an older crowd.

Juke boxes are always legit.
The whole bar smelled like mary jane.
author: Marlon T.

description: Stee makes the bar!  Shots & beer special is the move.  Pool table draws good players, mostly rad Efren Reyes type players who will give you one chance to come back to win...
author: Michael D.

description: Me and my wife went out in our vacation we like the place but I expected a little bit more but still it was OK.
author: Ofir M.

description:
What a great experience! Friend suggested coming here after dinner on a Friday night. The size of this dive bar's a 3rd of Dear Mom but it wasn't that crowded on this particular night. Lots of whiskey and beers at the bar. The bartender was generous with water too which some of my friends really needed!

To top it off, this bar plays awesome hip hop songs!!! Kind of like Brunos on Mission St which rocks. 

Good drinks, good music, good company. What's more can a girl ask for?
author: Jackie L.

description:
I think when reviewing bars it is really helpful to add the time and day you were there because the vibe can be dramatically different based on when you go. I went in to this humble looking establishment on a Thursday night at about 8:00pm and the place was mostly empty. I prefer more empty bars, especially at a place with an extensive menu, because it allows me to take my time and ask questions when ordering drinks. Well right now I am what a wealthy disabled man in a great movie about bowling might call a "bum". Hence, I wanted to try and get a good scotch but at a price that wouldn't make me feel more worthless. 

Enter bartender, me explaining my price range, of 8-10 bucks (I'm a bum that poorly manages his finances) and him giving me a great drink. Unfortunately, I was not able to enjoy more and my next drink was  PBR. As other mentions there is also a pool table so I was able to enjoy that and my PBR while lamenting my inability to purchase more scotch. 

The only negative for this place is the current lack of a drink menu/lack of prices. While the bartenders are very knowledgeable, most of the time it is preferable to avoid saying "whats the cheapest thing you got that ain't shit" or having to repeatedly ask how much different scotchs cost and then looking sadly at the bar when the price is announced. Hope they fix that!
author: Clayton V.

description:
Favorite straight up bar in the TL? I'd say so. $7 for a tall boy PBR and a shot of decent Whiskey. Fuckin' steal considering the Korean bars around the same spot charge over $7 just for a tiny shot of Jameson. Some of them use kid's sized glasses, seriously.

Pool table, check. Smaller place, run very well. The bartenders are always cheerful and happy to talk whiskey. 

Bonus points for letting me pick songs on the juke box when you put in some house money. I even warned you it was gonna be Gang Starr which may not be the norm for this type of bar, but you still said go for it. That made me happy; cheap beer, whiskey, Gang Starr and pool. I could die a happy man.
author: Justin N.

description: Whiskey theives is an awesome dive. They have a pool table and lonestar beer. The staff is always friendly and helpful when it comes to finding a new favorite whiskey.
author: Lauren M.

description:
The bar definitely has a Tenderloin divey feel, which I find to be good and bad at the same time. It seems like most people are in for PBR and Jameson, but I decided that I should test their whiskey-serving mettle and actually ask for something nice. I eyed their wall - they have all the classics. Macallan, Laphroaig, Glenmorangie, etc.

I asked the guy for some recommendations based on my current tastes. I hadn't tried Ardbeg before and it was suggested that I should try it considering that I liked Talisker (they are both Islay single malts.) I went for the 10 since I'm not made of gold, and it was really good. The only really incongruous thing was getting useful scotch advice from a guy wearing an oversized shirt, chains, and a backwards cap to match. But as my friends told me, it's SF -- don't jump to conclusions!

I appreciate the whole 'gem in the rough' feel, and that they actually serve good looking whiskey as advertised, but if I'm going to pay $12 for some scotch, I feel like I want a classier sort of place to go with what I'm drinking. I wouldn't mind coming back if someone dragged me here though.
author: Josh K.

description: Love this place. But be careful on the bar stools by the pool table. My dad smashed is face in falling off one of those. Wtf. Idk how it happened. Love their shot and beer specials Tho. I'll be back.
author: Kyle L.

description:
Like the music.  Like the drink prices.  Like the atmosphere.

This is a cool place we stumbled upon while bar hoping Geary.  Of those we visited, this was my favorite.  Although I'd have to admit it might take me a bit of convincing to get me back over the Geary St.

We definitely liked the shot of Jamison + PBR special, and so did the rest of the bar.  Wow, they go through SO many bottles of Jamison.  

The bartenders were readily available, quick, and friendly.  

I'm not sure what else I'd look for in a bar, but this did the trick.
author: Alexis B.

description:
I normally don't have as much fun in bars on Friday/Saturday nights as I do in the day time or on "school nights" because SF bars on Fri/Sat nights are packed with too many people, 95% of whom make me want to go home and drink alone in my underwear... even if it means making my drink my damned self. 

However... I went to Whiskey Thieves this past Saturday night for a friends birthday and had a splendid, comfortable time. I was able to sit at the bar, (whuuuttt???), have a conversation with my friends, receive my drinks in a timely manner, make friends with other bar patrons, and joke with the bartender. I didn't think that was possible at a cool bar in the city on a Saturday night. But Whiskey Thieves made it happen!

I have been to Whiskey Thieves many times and have always had a good time. Never any problems. Solid prices, solid service, a juke box and a pool table. They have my vote.
author: Liz M.

description: Sometimes you just want a bona fide dive bar. And that's where Whiskey Thieves delivers. Really nice bartender, chill atmosphere -- perhaps the Tenderloin is where it's at to get away from all the pretentiousness.
author: Mel G.

description: What a great after work place.  Small, low key, stiff cheap drinks, really how could one pass this place up.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
A pretty small place with a big whiskey selection. They have good specials. For 8 bucks you get a blue ribbon and a shot of whiskey.
However the bartender tried to give us pre made drinks that another customer didn't want. We were not gonna pay for a drink that had been sitting there for a while, getting stale. Who does this bartender think we are, stupid? Hell no! So there went his tip.
author: Matthew G.

description:
2 Double Dickels and coke,please. 

Yes, dickel. Some kind of whiskey from whiskey land, made by whiskey gods. 

Basically, parking around these parts suck. 
It smells like a hipster threw up in there. 
It smells like bad B.O. 
It's actually filled with hipsters. 

But I really love this bar, and the pool table is an excellent addition.
author: Thao L.

description:
It's divey yes. But it has CHEAP drinks. We had just left Jones and just started walking down Geary looking for something slightly less pretentious and decided to pop in for a drink. 3 cocktails ordered and they were top shelf 18 bucks. What? We've been paying close to 9 and 10 dollars per drink. Awesome.

I've been here for happy hour and it's a cool spot. But on a saturday night it's a bit hipsterish for my taste but not terrible. Definitely a good spot to get a cheap drink.
author: Hyung L.

description:
Cool bar with a cool staff and cool vibe.

We walked in at 130PM on a Saturday afternoon and hung out a bit.
They had a bunch of Whiskeys, Bourbon, Scotch, you name it. Lots of different brands of a varied price range. The bartender asked us what our price range was and asked if we wanted it on the rocks or with ginger. I preferred mine with ginger ale and the boy had his on the rocks. 

To be honest, I'm no whiskey connoisseur and mine tasted like what a Jameson ginger ale would :)

However, cool bar again with interesting murals/graphitti on the walls. I also love how they use barrels as tables along the wall. They also have a cool trap door for where their storage room is! Neat!!
author: Ling H.

description:
Stopped in on a warm day for a cold beer. Good service was provided in that respect, so 3 stars earned.

Caveat: Cash only? It's called Square and every place should have one by now. Even the most divey pool hall in Baltimore will take a swipe. It's not like there was a cash discount in play. The place felt a little full of itself. Like it was trying too hard to be a dive.
author: Alex S.

description:
This feels like a modern day Cheers in San Francisco.  Good selection, affable bartenders who help advise with tastings, and an unassuming atmosphere.  

Popped in for a drink on Saturday and had a blast with the other patrons.  It seems nice bars breed nice clientele.  Will defnitely make a repeat showing....perhaps even engage in a bit of premeditated grand larceny.
author: Ling C.

description:
This bar has character and a huge whiskey selection!

I don't like whiskey, but I still like this bar.  No pretention, cool people from all walks, cool bartenders.  Pool table, definitely a big regulars crowd, which is younger than most bars' regulars' crowds.

Do bring a friend, it's in a particularly creepy part of the Tenderloin...creepy enough to scare away most B&Ters : )
author: Lauren J.

description: Cool place! I went when it wasn't super crowded. It was easy to get a drink and they weren't very expensive. Bartender was pretty hot too. The bathroom doors don't really close or lock so (if you care) you have to use the buddy system, but other than that it's a chill place.
author: Laurie Z.

description: The bartender did a tasting on west coast whiskeys for us. Great collection. Found some new favs. Divey and fun. The only thing I'd change was the smoke wafting in because the door was open.
author: Gene R.

description:
As a whiskey girl, what is there not to like about this place.

There is more whiskey then I can count and friendly staff.

The only two things I don't like about this place is the rest room (now I know its a bar but this was pretty bad) and the over crowing. Maybe I'm a little old fashioned but I believe in being able to walk in a bar to get my drink, not feel the need to crowd surf just to get to the bar.
author: Cescilia A.

description: The TL is always great. The name is awesome. The drink specials are pretty good. I've been here a few times over the years and it's never crowded and always mellow.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
I dig a good dive bar- and the bartenders are personable and know what they're doing, which is always a major plus. And I am a whiskey person- and there is a ton of whiskey/bourbon to try. I ignore that the majority of the clientele aren't my crowd, as I have some coworkers who really dig this place and it truly isn't the worst in many regards.

I took of stars mostly because the bathrooms totally blow- the men's room anyway. It is a urinal and a single doorless stall, which may not be a problem for some but isn't very considerate to people who generally despise urinals, not to mention the transgender patrons. It blows to enjoy a place and then have to leave because of that nonsense.
author: Daniel F.

description: Fun neighborhood whiskey bar. Modest, but good selection. Bar tender is very knowledgeable and a good guy.
author: Tim P.

description: Might be an okay place except both times I've been there I've encountered an obnoxious patron with a Pit Bull ... no thanks, too many other bars in the area.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Whiskey Thieves has stolen my heart.

I thought my bud was kidding when he told me to meet him at Whiskey Thieves.  In this part of town?  I was fully expecting this to be a hipster dive.  

Thank goodness Whiskey Thieves proved me wrong.  The crowd was a mix of post-workday office workers, bike messengers, a sprinkling of hipsters, and so on...  My bud made introductions to his friend, and I took a seat with them at the bar.  

The salt n' vinegar kettle-cooked chips-munching redheaded bartender comes up and asks what I want.  Being the complete space cadet I can be at times, I blurted, "What whiskies do you have?"

She gives me an, "ok, smartass..." look, as I facepalm myself.  

I regain my composure and ask, "Would you happen to have anything smoky like Lavagulin?"

"What price range would you like to work with?"

"Let's keep it around $10, and surprise me if you would, please."

She comes back with her pick, pops the stopper with one hand, hands me the bottle with the other, and tells me it's ok to nose it.  I do as much, and a smile blooms on my face as I catch a whiff of peat, smoke, and brine.  My bartender croons, "Shall I continue?"

I nod entranced, like a guy having his first set of real life tits fall upon his virgin eyes.  The bartender's pour is almost pornographic as amber liquid flows like silk into my glass in luscious slow mo.  

...and that's the start to how I busted my Whiskey Thieves cherry that night.
author: Sam W.

description:
Whisky Thieves has a pretty damned good whisky menu. It's got a strangely charming decor (sort of 'Cowboy Chic' if that makes any sense). The bartenders are a little 'bro', but they seem to know their stuff where whisky is concerned. The beer menu could use a little work, but this is more of a liquor place anyway, so I guess that's less a bug than a feature.

This place gets pretty packed on the weekends, with a weird mix of the Bridge-and-Tunnel crowd, with a few hipsters thrown in for kicks. This place has been way more chill on the weeknights when I've been there, and the bartenders have been really happy to talk whisky with you when it's slower. 

There's only 1 pool table, but the jukebox has some good stuff on it and there's usually enough room to find a stool. This is a good place to grab a good whisky and mingle.
author: Kele T.

description:
Definitely a guys' place.  Wear whatever you want, especially a hoodie to fit right in.  Great selection of whiskey - an entire wall full!!This place isn't too bad, except it's cash only and the bartenders make you get up from bar stools because they save it for their friends.  Understandable, but meh, not so nice eh?  

Pool table - check. Cool old school arcade style video game - check. Wall full of whiskey - check. TL shit show outside where beezies brawl and everyone just watches? - check.
author: Dee H.

description: So the night was pretty fun cause I have awesome friends. The drinks are cheap which is great but watch out for the bartenders. The two girl bartenders were so rude I thought they didn't like the idea of people tipping them. I don't know what was putting those girls in a bad mood but I wouldn't recommend spending your money here. I was sitting at the bar observing and literally every person that ordered a drink got shit from the bartenders. Unless you are at dicks last resort in San Diego, that shit isn't acceptable. My advice, spend your cash at a place that treats you with respect.
author: Jelena S.

description:
Morning-after recollections:

Me: I think most people liked Rye the best out of the 3 bars we went to last night...
Hazel: You mean two.
Me: No, we went to three. Ambassador, Rye, and Whiskey Thieves.
Hazel: No, it was just two, we stayed at Rye.
Me: Uhh, no. We left Rye, and closed down Whiskey Thieves. I should know, I had a shot right at last call.
Hazel: I don't remember going there at all.

Yep. Sorry, Whiskey Thieves, I guess you're just not that memorable to some people. It might have something to do with your beer-and-shot specials. (More likely it was the accumulation of drinks from our previous stops, so don't feel too bad.)
author: Mike Q.

description:
Bourbon, Rye, Scotch, and Irish: Home away from home.
 
Our first night in SF, we have our first round of drinks at a lovely, albeit a bit shi-shi-la-la joint at the Westin St. Francis (Clock Bar to be precise). From there we begin our aimless wandering. With tap-tap-tap on our shoulders, a friendly fellow (officially dubbed, Bourbon Fairy) tells us we need to go to Whiskey Thieves. 

 "What is Whiskey Thieves?" we asked.

 "Trust me, you just need to go. It's on Geary St., up that way."  And then, like magic, he disappears into the crowds.

Well, who are we to question Bourbon Fairy? So, we made our way there passing a few trendy bars with uninteresting crowds.

Ah, here we are.
We walk in and its like being home. Kind of like the live wire- part dive, part home :)  With red walls, barrel tables, and Guns n Roses blasting, who wouldn't love this place? It wasn't crowded and it especially wasn't pretentious. Our bartender was awesome, letting us sample several single malt scotches and bourbon. I think we got a bit schnockered that night.

Needless to say, we had a lovely time and you'll be damn sure we'll be there the next time we roll into town.
author: kimberly m.

description:
There is no more smoking at this bar! Someone lied to me. 

4 stars for not enabling my addiction around the boyfriend. 

...Oh look, a pool table where guys who don't know anything about the rules of the game take shit shots and expect them to be counted. I was 2 sheets to the wind by the time it was my turn, and yet I still only managed to lose by one ball on the table--the 8 ball. That's right, assholes. Stacey is coming back to kick some ass.

First she has to figure out how to stay sober.
author: Jaime L.

description: Meh. It's just ok. I find it interesting that a lot of people call this a dive bar. It's filled with yipsters who are 'slumming it' in the Tl for the night. That's fine. There are a lot of other awesome places in the neighborhood.
author: Maya S.

description: Good neighborhood dive-bar. No frills.  A lot of regulars hanging out at the bar... one of those "where everybody knows your name" kinda joints.  Place is usually pretty hopping on the weekends with a good sized crowd out front. CASH ONLY and service-dog friendly.
author: Summer S.

description:
I've been here twice and both times I enjoyed the bar and the drinks.  The staff is friendly too. I prefer divvy sort of bars that, at least, look like they chase off the more pretentious types with a stick.  (That's not really true as the two times I've been there it's been with precisely that sort of crowd.)

When I'm in the area, I'll definitely hit this place up.
author: Regina W.

description:
Love this place!!!  

As a newbie in the TL, I was worried the only establishments to hang in would be crackhead and junky infested, thankfully I was mistaken.   

The regulars are quite nice, staff is friendly, and the prices and selection of whiskys are fantastic, plus they are always playing a game on the multiple televisions.

If you're in the TL check this spot out.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Not feeling decisive, I asked the bartender to make up a drink for me, telling her I liked citrus and leaving the rest to her.  Whatever citrus mint concoction she whipped up was delicious and only $6.  

It was a Tuesday night, but every seat at the bar was taken and a whole group was watching Wheel of Fortune rather excitedly.  Great ambiance!
author: Sona P.

description:
No pretentious wannabes allowed.

People who love and appreciate whisky should definitely check this place out - they've got an impressive collection, the bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly, and best of all...prices are much lower than those pretentious frou-frou "other places."
author: Mary M.

description: If I could give this bar a 0 I would. There's a bitch girl bartender with curly hair and she treated me and my party like shit.because some of my friends were black. I will have to report her to the manager.
author: Sasha L.

description: Sooooo divey. Bring cash. I'm not one for dives so maybe that's why I'm giving the low score. But when I walked in I felt like everyone stared at us bc we didn't belong. We didn't stay long needless to say.
author: Viktoriya Z.

description:
I liked it. I wasn't there long and don't remember much.....

Bartender serves a mean drink. Alluring men walk by whispering compliments in your ear...


*sigh* just another bit of Tenderloin heaven.
author: Alita M.

description: Hot bartender enough said. Nah cheap drinks too for happy hour and he was very nice.
author: Karen T.

description: I'm not big on whiskey. I'm not big on drinking. I'm just a light weight trying to hang with my folks. My boy is real big on whiskey and he thinks they have a decent collection. He may bring me here for whiskey, he may try to school me on how to appreciate whiskey, but the lesson isn't sticking. I do love the choice of artwork here. Even before he brought me in, I walked in to check out a few pieces. Folks are cool, both staff and patrons. The spot is small, but bigger than some other spots. I don't wanna call it a dive cuz they cleaned this place up quite well. I've been to this spot several times before before it was the Whiskey Thieves...if only I can remember the name (I was a much heavier drinker back then).
author: Helen L.

description: Never thought id encounter a bad bartender in one of my favorite dives. She seemed more concerned about arranging her cigarettes and talking shit about other people than serving. I love this place, just will never return on a Sunday afternoon. She was so unpleasant we instantly had to leave. Always have had great bartenders here????
author: Liz A.

description:
The Pixies on the jukebox = happiness.

Big cans of PBR = I am a classy bird.

Amazing selection of whiskey. Baseball on the TV. Pool table at the back. Mix of folks. Atmosphere was welcoming and friendly though.

I don't drink whiskey = stupid move.

But my friend does adore the stuff. I got a nerdy thrill at listening to the friendly bartender explain all about them to my nerdy friend who was shamed with embarrassment that I was drinking my $4 PBR.

I = Don't care what other folks think.
author: Annie L.

description:
Yes, you heard right. I am the very last person on the planet who has never seen an episode of Mad Men. 

I attempted to remedy this and ordered season 1 from Amazon. The problem however is that season 2 arrived today instead. 

The only things I know about the show is that lead actor is "hot" and gets a lot of action and that there is a lot of drinking during office hours.

Sounds a lot like my office, except for that fact that me being the lead actor is not "hot" and we drink wine and pass on the brown liquor.

But after hours I do venture out looking for classic city bars staffed by knowledgeable bartenders who take pride in their craft and create the perfect Manhattans. 

I've been spotted at nearby Bourbon and Branch on more than one occasion and it's a great venue to take your out of town guests. But for the real brown liquor experience this may be your spot. The cocktails here are just as good if not better and even cheaper. A 20 spot here can actually buy you two drinks.

The whiskey/bourbon selection here will impress. The bartenders can tell you every last detail of each and take the extra step and ask what you look for in a whiskey. The cocktail list is not as extensive as Bourbon and Branch, but you name it and they can make it. 

There are no house rules here and you can walk in without a reservation. Don't like the music? Then put a few quarters in the juke box and instantly change the mood. Just don't even think of playing any Katy Perry tunes.
author: V B.

description:
Came here to meet up a birthday girl and friends. dimly lit, no cover but once you go in, you better be okay with second-hand smoke bc there are a lot of smokers here. cigarettes and cigars. 

there's a pool table in the back and they have a handful of beers on tap. 

friendly bartenders, stools by the bar, chill crowd.. parking can be a little difficult.

i thought it was weird how they had plasmas above the bar showing infomercials...
author: Lauren Y.

description:
This place has been on my bucket list for quite some time. Two reasons. Obvi, whiskey is my poison. Bourbon specifically. Secondly, a little birdie promised me that the juke box contained The Cramps' "Let's Get $#@%ed Up." I love that song. One of my buddies got an old juke box, loaded his favorite records into it, and would start a night of drinking with that Cramps song. Best drinking song ever. I wanted to go to the bar just to play that song! Tom R.'s MeetUp group finally brought me here last night. 

As someone who became an orphan at a young age, I learned how short, valuable, and fragile our time is. As such, I decided that I would rather reget the things that I have done rather than the things that I have not. In short: take risks and learn from your mistakes. But, ugh, sonofabitch, I really really really really really regret waiting until my last month and a half in the Bay Area to finally get my ass to this beauty of a bar. A beauty it is too...a true diamond in the rough of the Tenderloin.

Those who know me well know how much I love whiskey. You should have seen my reaction when I saw the availble whiskeys. Eyes popping out of my head like those on a tightly-clenched squeeze toy....anxious smile of anticipation like that of a little kid on Christmas morning...I cried and came at the same time. Truly epic. I was too overwhelmed and I just stuck with something safe...the Maker's Manhattan on the rocks.

Lemme tell you, the bartenders aren't thrifty with their pours either. For the first time, I actually was filled with liquid courage..........I finally told my ex exactly why I left him. Maybe he'll be a better man because of it. Maybe he's a lost cause. Whatever, I got, like, three or four numbers last night. But that totally doesn't matter. (Hot guys like this bar, ladies.) What does matter is that this place is super awesome and I am sad that I will be leaving it behind this summer. 

Then again, are we really suprised that I dig this place? After all, I am a pierced, tattooed, foul-mouthed, whiskey-swilling bad girl with a geek streak from Livermore.
author: Zulu Q.

description:
Ye gods, does the Tenderloin host some great bars. In the interest of full candour, I was pretty drunk when I got here thanks to three delicious cocktails and a shot of Fernet Branca, which the bartender at Koko Cocktails asserted was part of the authentic SF experience. As I tottered my way over from there to here, a homeless guy helpfully schooled my companion in basic etiquette by yelling at him, "You take care of that angel now! Man, why aren't you walking on the outside? Walk on the outside!" This is also part of the authentic SF experience. However, I agree. My friend should have walked his lanky self on the outside of the pavement to protect me from the noxious contents of a chamberpot being emptied overhead, or its modern equivalent, the drive-by shooting. 

In short, I was drunk and had been described as an angel by a homeless guy, so I was in a great mood. Whiskey Thieves only served to improve that mood, because it had an enormous quantity of whiskey, of a variety of provenances and shapes and colours and flavours, but all uniformly alcoholic and reasonably-priced. They also had $4 draught beer and a $7 PBR or Tecate and Kentucky bourbon shot special. The jukebox was playing fairly unobtrusive and pleasant classic punk, and the lighting was a flattering shade of orange, and there was an aging George Foreman Grill behind the bar. I don't remember why it was there; I remember we asked the bartender about it, and he invited us to make panini on it if we wanted to, which was nice. 

What I do remember is that the bartender has an EPIC moustache; the kind of lush, old-growth moustache which on any other similar tall skinny hipster would make my eyes roll so far back into my head that I would actually be staring right at my atrophied prefrontal cortex. But no, there was no eyerolling here. This was a moustache as fat and proud and sleek as a Persian cat. This was an entitled moustache, one that I could not do anything but respect. Also, dude was cool, he answered all our stupid drunken questions about the George Foreman Grill and the beer/shot special. 

I like this place. It has whiskey, and a pool table, and a juke box, and a moustache with a bartender growing from it.
author: Laura T.

description: Great laid back bar with a good juke box and reasonably priced drinks. James is the best bartender in the city. Hands down.
author: Ravi K.

description:
Pre-drank before ISIS's farewell show @ Great American Music Hall. 20-30 people in here and it gets packed. This place is tiny and cool. An old man is cleaning up all the empty glasses that surround you.

He is mellow. 

 Dug my Manhattan, shot of whiskey with a Tall Can of PBR, and even got to talk with one of the friendly bartenders who was wearing a Genghis Tron shirt. Evidence right there that the Whiskey Thieves staff has good taste in music.

I'll drink to that.
author: Taj A.

description:
Our last stop of the epic bar crawl night was Whiskey Thieves. 

This place is owned by the same guy as Dirty Thieves and Thieves Tavern http://www.yelp.com/biz/dirty-thieves-san-francisco#hrid:PHAboVHKB2z9CtS-2P6lIw/src:self
http://www.yelp.com/biz/thieves-tavern-san-francisco#hrid:zHPaDLfWgAxZzCCGWCpt3A/src:self

This is the best of the three and my favorite bar in the TL. They have a great selection of Whiskey at great prices in an unpretentious atmosphere. 

I know why all the bars are named Thieves but it isn't really relevant to my review.

When we got here we waited outside for a bit, I can't really remember why, when Carl from Ha-Ra came up and called us traitors. I'm pretty sure he was joking though. I don't know who was running Ha-Ra at the time, there's an even chance he abandoned the customers as there is that he kicked everyone out and closed. 

Once inside Ashley and I got beers but Dupa disappeared for a bit. I assumed he used the bathroom but when he came back he asked me to order a beer because the bartender was ignoring him. It turns out that he asked for a rare whiskey thinking it was going to be $16 but when they gave it too him it turned out to be $60. Sorry Dupa but it seems pretty obvious that you heard wrong. I understand why Dupa didn't want to pay that much but I also understand why the bartender was pissed. Honestly we're lucky old Dupa wasn't thrown out.

Eventually Dupa and Ashley had to catch the Bart, why it doesn't run late on Friday's I'll never know, as they both came from the East Bay and I stayed a bit after them to enjoy some single barrel Jack. This was a fun night!
author: Manny F.

description:
For butt-cheap drinks and some of the friendliest bar tenders in the city, this is the spot fo sheez.

I was here at 11pm last Saturday night and was able to sit at the bar and discuss my drink choice (a $5 Manhattan) with the bartendress. When does that ever happen on a weekend night in this city?!

True, if you're the type that likes the over-dressed kids that parlay at the Ambassador, this probably isn't your scene, for me however, it's just right.
author: Shyla B.

description:
Good times!

I arrived here last night after escaping the marina (ahem, Taco Tuesday) to meet up with some friends. Fantastic bartenders, endless tall boy cans of PBR, and a seemingly extensive whiskey selection. I mean... I don't know what more there is to say. 

What is this about smoking though? I didn't notice any smokers, and I hail from a state where they JUST banned smoking in bars in May.
author: Kristin F.

description:
Small, dive-y, with an extraordinary list of all types of whiskey and stellar, helpful staff. Even if you don't know much about whiskey (as I sure don't), the staff will help you decide on a delicious beverage to soothe you. In addition to whiskey, they also happen to have a great selection of beer and a pool table! 

A word of warning: don't mix wine next door and whiskey - makes for an awful morning.
author: Tatyana K.

description: Divey enough to be fun and relaxed, nice enough to bring a date. Love this place, from the whiskey selection to the art on the walls. Can't wait to come back.
author: Johnny W.

description:
I really thought I wasn't going to like this place. Amongst all the shady dive bars (cough Nite Cap) Whiskey Thieves didn't seem like it would be any different. I fully expected to walk in to a room full of crackheads doing drugs and picking fights. 

When we stumbled in here drunk on Saturday night on our way home from the Snuggie bar crawl I was SO surprised at how awesome this place was. My SSO has always wanted to go here and I was always a little weary. Now I can't WAIT to go back!

They play awesome rock music and have a really great and diverse crowd. The drinks were reasonable and it had a pool table in the back which I look forward to getting in on in the future. 

I'm doing a Loin bar crawl for my birthday and WT is now definitely on the line up!!
author: Julia N.

description:
Great eclectic selection of whiskeys, and I do love them!

Love the bartenders.  They are super helpful if you want to explore their amusement park of adult libations.

Pool table.  Jukebox.

I love this place.
author: Theron L.

description:
Whiskey thieves is like homeless guy you talk to and then realize they're a millionaire.

At first glance this is just a nondescript dive bar - unambitious exterior, dark interior.  Gives off a rough vibe by the bouncer and patrons.   I was a bit skeptical at first.

I asked the bartender "Got anything like Sazerac?"  He got all excited and started giving me options, pouring me small tastes, until we finally found a great rye that was *better* than Sazerac.  

Eight moths later and I still go to this place at least every other week.

Whiskey Thieves tries only to be a friendly, down to earth place to drink  whiskey - and succeeds handily.

I honesty can't think of anything that Whiskey Thieves could do better and that gets them five stars.
author: Nathan M.

description:
Great bar with a good atmosphere and a vast selection of whiskeys.  I like to get the special $7 PBR and whiskey shot because I'm a cheapass.

Why did they get rid of the pacman game though?!?!  booooooo!
author: Dan D.

description:
I think this might be my favorite bar in the TL. They have an impressive selection of whiskey, bourbon and scotch - from well to top shelf, knowledgeable and skilled bartenders, a few nice beers on tap, a pool table and a jukebox. The bartenders are patient an helpful, and will even give you a sample shot to help you find something you like. There's also a market right across the street that has yummy Mexican food to-go that you can eat in the bar. Fantastic!

Happy hour runs until 8pm: Reviews say there's a $7 special shot + beer, $3 draft beers and well drinks, and $1 beers with a pour of whiskey.
author: Kristina A.

description:
That's a damn fine bar!

Came in here last night for the first time, and I'll definitely be back. The bartenders are really attentive and helpful, and the whiskey selection is nothing to shake a stick at. The prices seemed pretty moderate for the selection. The Whiskey and beer special is pretty lovely too, don't forget to ask about it!

Thanks for a great whiskey experience, Whiskey Thieves!
author: Mez L.

description: Another dive favorite. Although the seating is minimal, the jukebox reigns supreme. Went on a Sunday if I recall, and they had a mix of motown favorites, interspersed with some hip hop less than favorites, which seemed to be chosen at random by other patrons. Their whiskey selection is unsurpassed, and I was so happy to have them take the guesswork out of my choice, even though I'm generally a devout Jameson girl. My dear sweet thieves, whisking away my heart, filled with whiskey...something like that. I never said I was a poet.
author: Brianna S.

description:
This place likely warrants a higher than average review but this reviewer 1) doesn't know her whiskey and 2) was already tipsy off 4 drinks by the time she arrived. 

Several friends and I stopped by Whiskey Thieves late one recent Saturday night and all I remember is: 

1) many drinks
2) many dudes
3) a jukebox playing non-offensive music
4) a wall of bottles and at least a chalkboard sign
5) long corridor-like hall area between the front door and the pool table area in the back.

We left around 1am or 2am so we must have had a good time. I wish I could remember but all that really stayed with me is the memory of wishing I didn't throw back all those drinks the night before come 6AM the next morning.
author: Ida C.

description:
place is awesome....great staff as well.  they've got whiskey and drinks for all occassions, even one when you're super hungover (ask for the Angry American).

i've even pooped here with great satisfaction...
author: Colin L.

description:
Went here last night for another TDDOC. They do have a stellar selection of bourbon, rye whiskey, and basically anything else whiskey you could want (i think they had a 23 year van winkle!). 

But man, that 7$ special - shot + beer is awesome. They initially were using elijah craig and had to move to something better when they ran out - we brought a big group. The beer is a 22oz PBR (yes, they serve this outside of the mission as well).
author: David N.

description:
I tend to prefer it's slightly more airy sister in the mission, but similar to the other Thieves, Whiskey Thieves does have knowledgeable bartenders and stiff drinks. I think this would be a good place to start out for the night. Knock back a few cocktails and meet up with your friends. It wasn't crowded at all on a Saturday night which is good for being able to talk to people, but not so good when you've come from 4 other bars. In fact, in that case it's a bit of a downer.
While I usually love a dark hipster-esque bar, I gotta say this experience was more depressing than anything. Maybe it's the fact that the air still has a lingering stale quality from the days where people could smoke inside. 

I would give it another shot due to the quality of the staff.
author: Nikki M.

description:
There's a lot of things to be said about a good dive bar, but for me it boils down to one key component: The ability to walk-in and feel immediately comfortable. 

For me, Whiskey Thieves is that and I appreciate it. There's a perpetual $7 special for a shot of whiskey and a PBR. The whiskeys are known to change, so be careful, Ryes and PBR don't really go together.
author: Blake R.

description: We were on the birthday train for my girlfriends birthday celebration. Our first stop? Whisky Thieves. Never heard of it. When we arrived the place was dark and not yet packed of loin patrons. I didn't try the whisky but the $4 beer on top was not a bad choice. Pool table in the back and video game console in the front with vintage games like Donkey Kong and Frogger. Not a bad bar to hop to while in the loin.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
I just had my first Whiskey Thieves experience. I love Whiskey, I am not a big fan of thieves. The outside looks like your standard non-descript dive bar. Inside is like a haven, full of delicious, alcoholic, bliss. 

One half of the bar is full of your Bourbons and Ryes. The other half is Irish Whiskies and Scotch. I was in a Bourbon mood, but with such a selection, I was at a loss. My friend, who I came with and was buying, asked what some of their best bourbons were. The bartender pulled 3 bottles and poured samples for us.
