After the fire that shuttered Benders on S. Van Ness (hopefully temporarily) I was looking for a new watering hole, preferably in the TL/Nob Hill area where i live. After my first visit, I had the post office fwd all my mail to Whiskey Thieves.
Its outlaw-country with a rock and roll jukebox and the whiskeys...oh the whiskeys! Remember that rare rye you've been trying to find? They got it. Cool bartenders too. And don't miss weenie-wednesday for some free dogs to sop up all that whiskey!
author: Todd B.

description: I love walking into a bar on a slow night, having the bartender all to yourself, being able to sit anywhere, and this was my first experience at Whiskey Thieves. I love going out in the TL, so I already knew it would be great. I ordered Basil Hayden's, neat, but he was out so he surprised me with something "hotter." It burned like fire, and enjoyed that burn. It's dark, small, and they know their whiskey.
author: Merrilee T.

description:
Not only do they play GREAT music all night, but after asking my friend, " i wonder what the difference is between --whiskey and  ----whiskey--?" the bartender gave us both a free shot of each! 
i can think of no greater bar.
author: Joanna R.

description:
I love this place, why don't I go here more often.

Its big, has great music, hot bartenders .you can smoke inside . i wish i lived closer, i'd be here all the time
author: Lauren V.

description:
I love love LOVE this place.

Its smokey, divey, and AMAZING.

The crowd is really fun and the bartenders (especially one in paticular;) are AWESOME and make a mean drink! Especially Cezar with his mad bloody mary skills!!

I love this place!!
author: Keila E.

description:
I have only been to this joint twice ... but ... each time has been nothing but great. I love whiskey, I smoke a tobacco pipe and I love dive bars. What a combination!! 

This is easily one of my favorite places throughout the city I choose not to live in. 

Word.
author: Brandon L.

description:
Go here to smoke.  Go here to drink.  Go here to talk to a guy who has a life not dissimilar to the kid from Rule of the Bone, and most likely sells meth; or anyone else who appears to run along that same continuum.

It's definitely a scene for those who don't like the common usage of the word "scene."  You know the crowd I'm talkin' about.  If you're part of it, you'll love it.  If you're not, you most likely will still enjoy yourself so long as you're part of the nicotine persuasion.
author: Nicole A.

description:
This place was the start for  a very drunken adventure... actually the shots of wild turkey 101 in my apt were the start but I digress..

Very classic sort of dive bar: Not much in the way of ambiance or aesthetic but cheap booze and lots of it!

If you don't mind chasing cheap whiskey with cheaper beer then the $7 whiskey + pabst is perfect for you.

I like this place a lot as either the start to a very very drunken night or mid way through a slightly less inebriated venture.
author: Nick E.

description:
super bartenders who know their stuff.      tip them well. 

before 9pm get a $1 PBR with your shot. ($2 after 9pm)

no, I don't work here. 

we stopped by last Friday on our way to GAMH and it was like coming home. only to no home I'd ever known. I was just reaching out to accept a shot of rye and a PBR from my new bartender friend. 

At one point I looked down and I didn't know where his hand ended and my hand began...it was like magic!
author: Blue R.

description: The bartenders here are really nice. Great service. However, It was unfortunate that they have a cash only policy and their ATM was broke. I was happy with their selections. The space is large, so it is ideal for a large group of people. Not the best place to be on the warmest night in SF.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I try not to end up here as the night progresses as the term "smoky clothes" becomes a reality.  I don't really smoke all that much, I'll have a few on the weekend if i'm drinking but nothing over 6 or 7. This bar will make you smoke more and it just heightens my hangover. hahaha Damn you!

I like the fact that they have the little sophia champagnes and for being a tendahloin "dive bar" they have a nice updated/fairly clean bathroom!
author: Ariana M.

description:
Love this bar! 

Always friendly service with a smile. 

It's one of the few bars I feel comfortable going to alone. 
VERY friendly clientelle. I mean friendly... 
Met a European couple on their honeymoon there this week.. I guess they both thought i was cute and open to their kinky European ways.
But... my date showed up.  HA! 

Love the digital jukebox! 

basically all i can say is LOVE IT.
author: Towanda S.

description:
This is an "it is what it is bar". Doesn't pretend to be anything that it's not~~~ and it is AWESOME.

Whiskey Thieves, I love you.
author: Kellyanne i.

description:
This place is in my old neighborhood - yep, I lived here way back in 1989, the year of the Loma Prieta earthquake and a much different place in space and time. Back then, the Tenderloin was, well, the Tenderloin, and I couldn't walk down the street without being hollered at by homeless drunks or propositioned by yuppies slumming their way down Hooker Highway Hyde Street for a dose of Asian tranny booty and a few bumps in a piss and fish smelling alleyway. But I digress. 
We shambled into Whiskey Thieves last weekend for a few pops before a show at the Hemlock. I don't know squat about whiskey, except that the last time I drank it, I ended up puking with my mom. Nuff said. 
The friendly bartender noticed my duh-face when I stepped up to the bar and quickly suggested the special - a shot of whiskey and a beer for 8 bucks. He recommended the Rock Hill Farms (I only remember this 'cause I actually wrote it down). It was smokey and sweet and smooth. Folks here seemed friendly and relaxed. The bartender actually checked in with us later to see how we liked his suggestion. We felt welcomed and relaxed. 
Three rounds later, I treated my friends to rambling reminiscences about inviting strangers to spend the night when they were left homeless during the 'quake; the time I saw Jerry Garcia in a divey steakhouse on Larkin, obviously hankering a snack after seeing a man about some horse;  and the time I naively walked home by myself from Das Klub by taking a short cut up 6th street at 3 am. After all that whiskey, beer, and nostalgia, along with an ear splitting night at Hemlock, I went home and watched the ceiling spin for the next 15 hours. Good times.
author: Delilah P.

description:
This place has one of the best whiskey collections in SF. The bartenders usually know their whiskey, but it appears they have recently hired some new people who know less. Perhaps this is why they no longer allow smoking, since the owners no longer only work behind the counter.

They are redoing their whiskey list currently, so make sure to look at the price on the bottle before ordering. It is very common for two similar bottles to have wildly different prices. I almost ordered an Irish whiskey, before I saw it was $75 per shot.

This is not a place for a high class date...go to Nihon or Bourbon and Branch if your lady likes the brown spirits. This place is great for a casual evening, where you can explore a number of styles.

An extra star to the bar tenders who usually offer a free taste before purchase.
author: Jason L.

description:
Well the name said it all for me! When I heard about this place I just had to go. I found Whisky Mecca in the worst part of town. This is what a dive bar should be like. I LOVE IT. 

Yes another Whisky heaven for me to drink at. If you love Whisky and you are on a budget get in to this place. Run don't walk or I will drink it dry before you get here. 

A real nice staff and a great selection. I like going on nights when other people have to get up and work the next day. (since I don't have to get up till around 11am) I know the world is not equal and all that blah blah blah. 

In any case check this place out. They have a pool table as well. I would suggest that you take a cab since it is not so great of an area to leave your car or you can park in the garage next door.
author: don h.

description:
whiskey has def been the thief that has stolen my ability to recall the last few outings...  

is it possible to go back to the clear stuff? but it tastes so good!

whiskey thieves...
-great selection, not great for recollectin'.  ya feel me?
-happy hour steals, generous pours.  
-cool jukebox, uncool stale cigarette smell.
author: jane d.

description:
I love Thieves. And I don't even smoke. The whiskey selection is great along with very knowledgable bartenders: Tell them what kind of flavors your looking for and they will match you to a great whiskey.

The smoke can get thick at times, so if you have a problem with it find somewhere else.
author: Peter C.

description: Yep-chill whiskey bar it is. Great selection of rare whiskeys, scotches and bourbons. Super nice owners, bartenders and customers. It's a little rocky gem in the 'hood.
author: Catherine C.

description: The jukebox ate my dollar! Oh man, I had the strongest Manhattan of my life. From where I was sitting, I could see the bartender pour bourbon for 5 seconds? I seriously thought he was making two. No no. It was just mine. Prefaced by my friend coming over with the fateful words: "oh my god. We are going to die tonight." Well, I guess that was only half true, meaning just me....Sigh...oh well, the night ended with soul gratifying ramen at Katana-ya.
author: Faye P.

description:
Simply put GREAT BAR...

Any place this day and age you can smoke inside at is pretty sweet in my book and the fact that it's a block and a half from my place doesn't hurt any either.

Erotic Photo Hunt and a game of pool help to pass the time as you listen to pretty much any song you can think (2 credits if it's not already on the machine) of on the jukebox.

All the bartenders are pretty cool as well, guess that's a result of them all owning a piece of the establishment.

Last but certainly not least great bourbon and heineken dark
author: Josh V.

description:
OK, so obviously if you're not a smoker then this isn't the place for you.  I don't feel too badly for you though because it's not like you don't have 657 gazillion other places to go.  Plus - you have your health....so be happy and go somewhere else.

I'm a beer guy myself, but I respect a good "theme" - the staff are good at service.  They never take too long to get to you and serve it up quickly.

The vibe is low key.  The people are non-pretentious.  It's a great place to grab a drink and it's well within stumbling-home distance from my apartment.  I'm always suprised how popular the place is.  The patrons always seem very happy to be there - always a good sign
author: Daniel H.

description:
Rowans Creek.  Check. Caol Isla.  Check.  Rittenhouse.  Check.  Black Maple Hill. Check.  Bernheim.  Check.  Ardbeg.  Check.

It's right around the corner from me, and I seem to have stumble in there already drunk, and wearing a suit.  Being in a suit brings on a stronger desire for whiskey, I think, and I get looks.  But I don't care.  Why?  1.  I look good. 2. I have whiskey.  

Ever since they have assorted a bar menu I seem to open it infront of a patron who loves to make a comment. Once it was, "they have a lot of whiskey here."  Really?  Crap, I thought this was called schnapps thieves.  The second, "try the middletons."  And then, "really, middleton's good."  Finally, to the bartender, "I told him middleton's but he didn't listen."  Okay I know its 'Very Rare,'  but I wanted single malt scotch whiskey.  I needed an Islay fix.  I wanted to taste bandaids. But thankyou for letting me know that I picked a lesser drink.  Thank you, oh distillery expert.

I can only stay for one drink in this place cause the smoking drives me out.  But I love the bartenders.  I am in there infrequently, but they always recognize me and make me feel at home.  I love this place.
author: Ashby U.

description: i think i got here around 1:30AM it was pretty hipster hell for me and the chick playing pool with no bra on with a tight tank top wasn't too noticeable.For me i am an Local home grown San Fransisco young lady who likes to rock her sf giants meagestic jacket but some bitches be eye balling then my friend let his blunt and now this bar got better the spilled paps aint for me . also bar tender is a nice bitch so ill  throw another to the ground.
author: Seaera T.

description: Great place to feel like shit in the morning. Consider this place a physical representation of all things great and all things poor. It's like the mason-dixon line between derrelism and finding faith in demi-gods. A wonderful place to fall inside women's vaginas, meeting strange leprechauns and wakeing up with general anxiety and diaherea. They have a good whiskey selection which is great, but not so great for me as an alcholic. Thank god they don't let you smoke here anymore. That was an intelligent business decision. They need to get rid of the digital jukebox next.
author: Andreas T.

description: This place is nuts! Came here on a Tuesday nights to have it be some sort of Tequila night? Pablo behind the bar makes this concoction which is supposed to be a chaser. Tomato juice, orange, and something something. I hear Thursday night is FREE whiskey tasting night. And Monday night they whip out the George Foreman grill and make sandwiches! Drinks are awesome and the juke box in the back? Not a bad idea either. Love the tenderloin!
author: Emily C.

description: By reading the great reviews on Whiskey Thieves I thought I was going to discover a new favorite whiskey, instead I got a bartender who forgot to look for "Linkwood" when I asked and said that he is more knowledgeable about bourbons.
author: Tiff T.

description:
4 stars for the place
-1 star for allowing smoking.

Great selection of whiskey (I found one I really like - Dickels)
They give out lots of samples, and have generous pours. Fun whiskey bar!
author: Robert B.

description: This was one of our stops for my birthday a few months ago, and I've been back several times. I love their selection and the fact that their prices for the same top-shelf stuff is cheaper than other places also rocks.
author: Sid M.

description: Whiskey has been my favorite neighborhood bar since before I moved into the neighborhood. For a few years I used to travel from the sunset to wet mt palate with their tasty libations.  Whiskey has awesome bartenders with heavy hands, an incredible selection of  whiskey in all different price ranges, and a sassy new remodel in the works (heads up, they switched the bathrooms!). If your looking for a dark dive bar in the TL that doesn't feel like you made a wrong turn down a dark alley, this is it!
author: Meredith K.

description: Went here to see my lovely cousin and greet her a happy effin birthday. Since I missed decades of her birthdays, i came for a couple drinks..Nice place, very chill. Bartenders were on point and very friendly.
author: Trisha C.

description:
I love this place.  It's a great neighborhood bar, or it's worth making a trip out for if you're not in the area. The selection is amazing, the prices are reasonable, and nobody is going to look down their nose at you if you're not a whiskey expert.

The bartenders' knowledge is encyclopedic (a whiskeypedia, i heard someone say) and they're always happy to offer advice or setup a tasting.

The art rotates and you'll see different local work on display.  Sometimes really amazing, sometimes less.  Always interesting.  I stay away when it's really crowded, as it often is on Fri/Sat.
author: Luke M.

description:
This is my home away from home. Literally. I have a cot set up in the broom closet where I sleep 2 nights a week after closing. Don't tell any of the bartenders though, I'm a little embarrassed about it and I want them to think I'm cool.  You can smoke in this bar so I make up for my not smoking the rest the time by smoking an entire pack here within the confines of the bar. It somehow cancels itself out, so don't think too hard about it. There is not one bartender/owner that is not absolutely fantastic at what they do and do it with a great attitude. And that goes for everyone who has worked there during the 2 1/2 years I have been going there. Wow, I drink a lot. Anyway, they have a video crack machine at the end of the bar and a kick ass digital jukebox, changing art on the walls and a pool table. I have never seen any real drama go down there, always feel safe and I just really love the crowd (go regulars!) and staff.  I'm happy to see their success (even though I hope neither the marina chode or hemlock hipster quotient gets too high, as that has been known to happen when a kick ass bar in a now-cool area gets found out).  I've made some really cool friends there. You've seen me through a lot Whiskey Thieves and you are still my favorite bar EVER!

Oh, and they of course have a pretty amazing whiskey selection.
author: Magi C.

description: This is the only bar in the neighborhood that I still enjoy. Whiskey thieves attracts a younger crowd but not obnoxiously young. The place has excellent whiskey, knowledgeable bartenders (well, Lori at least), an unassuming atmosphere and a super cool bouncer. If whiskey thieves where an exotic fruit, it would be a honeydew melon.
author: Ian T.

description: Decent vibe, but way too many hipsters. The mixed drinks also kind of suck. Their bartenders wield sweet vermouth as if it were going out of style.  Good whisky and beer selection, though. Until very recently they allowed patrons to smoke inside, which was rather disgusting. They finally  accrued enough fines that they had to start obeying the law, and the quality has improved since. Still, the place feels like "this is where Zeitgeist rejects go because they're still working on being bitter enough to work at Zeitgeist".
author: Michael H.

description: I'm not sure if Pablo works at the Thieves anymore but he was the worst bartender I've ever seen and the main reason I stopped going. The guy looked AND smelled like death. Truly an awful experience.
author: thekicks g.

description:
went in for the first time last night. first impression:

-good crowd for a wednesday night

-good music playing

-reasonable prices

-awesome bartenders (tim and jenna)

-crazy selection

will be back!
author: Alicia J.

description:
cry me a river... they banned smoking. 

great bar! the bartenders are awesome. the music is great (as long as some dumbass isnt picking songs)


great drinks. great times. pass me a PBR and a shot of jameson
author: Chelsea H.

description: When you first walk in it's like stepping into an old western saloon..until you see the giant screen TV and the awesome XM satelitte jukebox.  Great decor, handmade galvanized steel bar tops, a pool table and some of the best bartenders in SF.  A place to definitely not pass up!
author: Jilly B.

description: Sweet Bourbon, smokes, a digital jukebox, a pool table and cool tenders.  WORD~
author: Joyhan S.

description: Bar is pretty chill and the crowd is regular but sometimes you get that vibe like everyone is a little high on the fact that they are regulars. Both times I have gone there I go the feeling like they weren't used to or didn't want to see new faces.  And be prepared to come out smelling like a fucking ashtray.
author: Dru P.

description: This place might be awesome, or might not be. I couldn't tell, because as soon as I walked in I thought I was going to die from all the smoke. Almost had to throw away the clothes. I hope to give it another try sometime, maybe in the morning, after it's aired out a bit.
author: Andrei Z.

description:
a wall of heaven. a wall of tasty hard to find burbons and whisk(e)y

 a wall wating to drain every penny i own. a wall of things that we have collected at home.

so why go out and pay 25+ for something i have at home?! 
if you get there early enough its a dirty old man bar and i love when their dentures drop on onto the bar when lil ol me orders something that will put hair on my chest. 
impressed. totally.
author: dawn a.

description: I love Whiskey Thieves. I have been here a few times now with friends and it has never disappointed.  They have a good special where you get a shot of whiskey (Makers Mark, Jameson and a few other choices) and either a Miller High Life or a PBR for $6. Awesome.  They also have really knowledgeable bartenders.  Two thumbs up!
author: maggie c.

description: It's dark, they have miller lite in a bottle.  It's the perfect anti-dote after a night at the Ambassador.
author: Amme P.

description:
I am giving the owners of this bar one star. How can you allow some retard play his electric guitar outside your venue for over an hour!? At 1:30 am. You should have bashed his head in and put him on fire with your fancy whiskey.

Boooo!
author: Maggie X.

description: Loved it. Drinks are strong, VERY strong. The bartenders are good looking, jukebox had a great selection, cool bathroom, good vibes, great atmosphere.
author: Rolly H.

description: So this is my weekend of finally going to places within 100 yards of home and kicking myself for not going sooner.  Popped in at this bar for a beer after dinner and was pleasantly surprised...first there was dave, a very fun, friendly bartender; chimay on tap; and the totally critical, totally acceptable jukebox--willie nelson and velvet underground.  Another plus is that they carry anchor steam's small batch rye and single malt...didn't get around to those on this trip, but I am already planning my order for next time, which will have to be a wednesday so as to take advantage of weenie wednesday when hot dogs are free during happy hour!!
author: L W.

description: Cheap drinks and pretty strong. It's a total dive but I dig it. Tables to chill out or bar space. They make a good manhatten and I know, that's my thing. The bar service is quick, when I went there weren't a ton of people in there so it was nice. An all around cool, dark place to come chill and burry your sorrows (or whatever) in a tumbler of pure happiness, Maker's Mark.. Or for you quick shooters.. a little Jameson.. sounds nice.. for you switch hitters or guys.. Black bush is there too..
author: Jess P.

description:
This place used to be the old Julip, which was more upscale and tried to draw the younger, more beautiful crowd back in the day.

Now as Whiskey Thieves, they haven't changed the internal layout much at all.  Cleaner than a divebar, unfortunately this place seems to also lack the character of a good dive bar.  As a neighborhood bar, it seems to also fall a bit short, still being a bit too upscale for its location.... which is undoubtedly the Tenderloin.

Our bartender was cordial enough, and Whiskey Thieves does have a better-than-average selection of Whiskeys, including locally distilled Old Potrero, made by Anchor Brewing.  

I think we ordered gin and tonics that day, and I remember them being not particularly cheap, but a bit on the watery side.  

But my biggest beef is with the imposing bar counter.  The counter is very high and uninviting.  There is a huge pillar that cuts the bar in half and the bar itself so dominates the room that it makes it difficult to look around the room easily.  You feel like your bartender is standing in a hole in front of you.

All in all, I like the fact that Whiskey Thieves is there, but it doesn't do anything that Aces up the street does better.  Two stars.
author: Dave N.

description: I love this place.  My drinks have always been stiff and inexpensive, and the bartenders super friendly.  The only problem is that I go for one drink, and I stay for ten.  Oh, and that jukebox?  6 stars.
author: Kerry L.

description: i heart me some whiskey! I was thrilled to hear about a whiskey bar in a dive bar setting...so once I arrived I was taken back by their selection. Looking (I'm sure clueless) at the different shelves I ask the bartender for a recommendation...I let her know what I like (of course the stuff that I liked were on the bottom and the second to the bottom shelves) the bartender responds with "Oh...you're a beginner." Okay...i guess i am :( but I was presented with a Elmer T. Lee which was really nice. So if you happen to head over to whiskey thieves and are a "beginner" and enjoy bourbon order the Elmer T. Lee so don't look like such a ham.
author: Paola W.

description: I LOVE WHISKEY.  This little whole in the wall with a sweet jukebox and pool table has soooooo much whiskey I don't know where to start.  Fun place to rock out with friends and experience some high end whiskey.  I don't smoke cigarettes but you leave like you have.  Smoking is not an issue indoors.  Bad ass place.
author: Evan L.

description: I know nothing about whiskey except what I learned playing "Don't F--- Your Wingman" in college with a bottle of JD. And that lesson was that whiskey and I are not friends (damn you, Little Friend initation). Anyway, I went to this bar with a group of whiskey lovers, hard drinkers all, and promptly ordered a mai tai. Yes, I totally did. And you know what, the bartender smiled and made me an amazing one. Cheers to you, cute bartender!
author: Noelle Q.

description: What a fun spot for a beer and a game of pool. The fact that you can smoke in this bar, can make the air a little dense, but I love it!
author: Beth M.

description: Any place that has 20 plus whiskeys to choose from is ok by me.  And what a selcection, from the lowest of lows to the highest of highs.  Not to mention the music kicked much ass and it wasn't to croweded.  Granted it was sunday night, but hey it is my favortite night to go out, so what can I say.  If I lived in the TL, I would be here every night.
author: brian m.

description:
My Kiwi friends who were in town from London were really satisfied with their American dive bar experience at Whiskey Thieves. If that's what you're looking for, you're in luck! We ran across this bar on a recent weekend trip to SF. The sign outside is really cool and drew us in. 

Inside, we found all the quintessential qualities...and more. The bar is dark; the bartender serves strong drinks; and the crowd was entertaining, slightly punk, and mostly drunk. Being surrounded by smoke took us all back a few years. This place is really smoky, so be prepared if you go in.
author: A S.

description: Love this place; we go here every time we're in town. It's the last place in the city (maybe the state?) that you can smoke in a bar -- because they don't have employees! That makes a real difference in the service, too: the bartenders, who are all co-owners, are exceptionally knowledgeable about their whiskeys. There's a pool table and a great jukebox and a phenomenal energy to the place.
author: Elisa Jo H.

description: I went to this bar when they still was allowed to smoke inside! Prices are great, as well as the people. If I ever go back to SF, I'll be back to WT!
author: Romy P.

description:
the trifecta:

1.  cheap 
2.  strong
3.  smokey


this bar is a haven for people who want to drink with people who know how to, smoke with people who don't give a shit, and hear tom petty, loretta lynn and nin back to back.  the bartenders are all co-owners of the establishment, and treat it as such.  a place to be proud of if you're involved and a place to return to if you're lucky enough to stumble upon it.
author: calamity d.

description:
total middle of the road.  it wants to be a dive but i think its gonna have to wait about thirty years to get that lived-in shithole feel that makes most dives appealing. 

however, i feel its probably a good happy hour destination if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Markus B.

description:
people who are calling this place a dive don't really know what they're talking about.  whiskey thieves is a scene compared to the ha ra down the street.  it's a cool place to go if you wanna smoke in a bar with a great whiskey selection.  but the people you'll find there don't seem all that different than those at the edinburgh or the hemlock.  i'm just saying...

still, my friends and i had a great time there a couple of weeks ago and we prefer happy hour to prime time there.  

and yeah, get this: free hot dogs on wednesdays.
author: Eleanore T.

description:
This bar has changed since they eliminated indoor smoking, and so far not for the better. The crowds seem sparser and the atmosphere, now clear of lingering smoke from two-dozen cigarettes, appears far more inviting. If this was ever a dive bar (really, it is more of a 'neighborhood bar')  that divey feeling evaporated with the exhales of the last 2am smokers. 

Fortunately, there are a dozen reasons to keep coming back, even for us smokers. The staff is top notch, both personally and professionally, and the whiskey selection is borderline incomparable. The juke box is one of those new-fangled internet machines, but the default selections gear towards alternative and metal. There is a pool table, though on busy nights it is surrounded by high-skill players, which may intimidate some. Local art is always on display. Drinks are cheap and even cheaper during their extended happy hour. 

The whiskey selection is truly fantastic and the bartenders will be happy to chat about it and offer samples when they aren't busy. Great beer selection for the beer drinkers. Wednesday night they offer up free hot dogs with some basic fixins to accompany your cheap happy hour drinks. Despite the clear air and clean presentation, the bar is kept fairly dark, which is the only reason I can see for some people to label this place a 'dive". 

If you're looking to 'slum it up' and take an 'adventure' to a 'dive bar', don't come here - you will be disappointed. Try the Outsider across the street.  If you are a big Whiskey fan and/or you live in the neighborhood and you've never been to Thieves, repent now and get your ass on a bar stool.
author: Phil D.

description: This neighborhood bar is perfect for good whiskey and strong drinks.  They always have a shot and a beer special for $6 and all the other cocktails are cheap as well.  They have a great juke box and pool table in the back.  It gets really crowded on the weekends so try and stop by during the week to get yourself a seat at the bar!
author: Tara S.

description:
So i am at the high tide in the loin, and we decide to move on over to whiskey thieves...in my friend's minds anywhere that is dark, smokable, and cheap works for them (and for me). So we are walking over there and I get a call from my mother... she tells me my family thinks i am an alcoholic and that she is "staging an intervention". YES i DRINK...NO... I am NOT an ALCOHOLIC.... alcoholics go to meetings... i am just a drunk....
so in defiance of her blatant lack of faith and trust in her daughter i GOT WASTED...screw eating dinner that would fuck up my buzz... 
so i buy a pack of cigs (i finally broke...i quit 4 months ago) and began my experience at the thieves. I loved it! Granted the bartender mistook my 20 for a 10 and charged me full price when it still happy hour, but i don't care i'll be back... the art that is up right now is super cool too. and we met the coolest korean dude ever who was all crazy and kept wanting to listen to Madonna...." you must be my lucky star....."
in the end i pulled an olivia, hopped a geary and made it home in time for grey's anatomy.... all in all a splendid evening!!!!
author: o. c.

description: My man friend cannot get enough of this place. I do like it, but think it can be smoky and not being a fan of whiskey am not all that impressed. But it is a fun bar for an afterwork cocktail.
author: Adrienne G.

description:
there's nothing like walking down the street being told i am "a fine piece of ass" by a man missing a tooth or two. or better yet, meeting a man dressed like a pimp who tells me "i've made a lot of good money from a lot of bad girls" for no apparent reason. well, if those are things that really get your feathers ruffled, i recommend a stroll to whiskey thieves. not only will you meet a homeless man who looks like he just bought his fit from the men's warehouse; but you will get damn good drinks to some damn good tunes!! 

unfortunately, i am no whiskey connoisseur. i would say i'm much more of a tequila and vodka kind of girl. however, i enjoyed a fine beer at a reasonable price. i met pablo. he was the ever so gracious and cool bartender who catered to all of my sierra nevada needs. i liked the laid back feel of thieves. there's a pool table for those who care to play and a bar filled with...dun dun dun...whiskey! 

i imagine thieves would be the kind of place i would go to everyday after work if i lived within walking distance. it has a dive-esque laid back feel that i could continuously enjoy a brew at time and time again. 

ps....thieves is a cash only establishment, however they do have an ATM machine right when you walk in. they're also, from what i was told, no longer a smoking bar.
author: Kristin Y.

description: I've been going here since the owners of Dalva opened it as Julip. Now its Whiskey Thieves with the same dope jukebox and a more lively personality. I'd probably go here more often, but I can't remember the last time I left this place with the ability to walk a straight line. They have Kronenbourg 1664 on tap - nuff said.
author: Mike C.

description: I enjoy this bar.  You can smoke inside, the drinks are fairly priced and poured on the heavy side.  Seating is minimal and the bar is very narrow, which sucks when its a busy night.  The pool table is usually occupied and last time I was there, ocupied by this not so nice fellow with a mound of quarters who was playing by himself and hogging the table.  Now, I know the rules of pool.  Set your quarters down and you have to challenge the winner.  A group of us just wanted to play a game, a quick crappy game since none of us can play, but homeboy wouldn't budge.  Guess you can't expect much decency from a guy who graffitied his own hat with a sharpie marker.
author: Christina S.

description:
I wish i could say that i started this resolution out with a bang. unfortunately though, i started it by going to a bar at 6pm which obviously isn't the liveliest and most fun time to check out a bar. why was i out drinking at 6pm? well, if you've got a resolution to hit up 50 new bars in one year, and you're sitting around doing nothing, then hell, why not?

I chose whiskey thieves because it's in the Tenderloin. Actually, i have a feeling that i might end up going to the Tenderloin a lot this year since it's a neighborhood i really haven't explored at all. yeah, it's one of the most sketchy, filthy, and uninviting areas in SF and lots of people avoid it like the plague, but I get the feeling that there are really some cool hidden spots over there that don't get the credit they deserve just because of their location.

in front of the bar, they had their logo shimmering and lit up through galvanized steel, which was a pretty cool effect and kind of had a techno-pirate kind of feel to it. inside, there was more galvanized steel along the wall and the place actually looked a bit fancy to be just another dive bar. as the name implies, this place is all about whiskey and they actually have a four page whiskey menu with a ton of different kinds. unfortunately, i couldn't tell a $50 whiskey shot from a hole in the ground, and the only whiskeys i recognized on the menu were Jack Daniels and his other cheap-ass friends. I've drank my fair share of Jack, so i decided to try his cheapo friend called George Dickel, which ended up being pretty good. Other than whiskey, this place had a bunch of beers on tap including Chimay, and also sold my favorite beer, Hoegaarden, which you can't find in a lot of places. Actually, just the fact that this place has Hoegaarden makes it good in my book, now if they could only get it on tap...

Like i said, it was only 6pm, and the bar had just opened for the night, so it was pretty dead. there were probably only like 5 other people in the place, so the three of us just sat around at a table and drank. the place had a pool table which we didnt try, and apparently Tom's favorite pinball game ever, which we didnt get to try either since it was mysteriously unplugged soon after we arrived. they also had one of those tech jukeboxes that downloads songs off the internet, so we ordered a few songs, although it was kind of a rip off at $1.00 per song. our songs didnt play till about a billion songs later, which is weird cause i never saw anyone put a ton of money into the jukebox. i read later that Whiskey Thieves is one of the few bars in SF where you are allowed to smoke, but we weren't sure of this at the time since there were some no smoking signs posted.

Anyways, overall i thought this place was really cool. the drinks were decently strong, selection of beer was good, and it seems like it'd be a fun place to hang out later in the night when there are more people. hopefully I'll go back there some day and check it out again...

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com)
author: vlad k.

description: Cheap drinks and friendly bartends.  Ive been here with my coworkers twice and both time the bartender has been really nice.  The last time he even gave us free drinks.  the best part is well the name, since whiskey is my favorite.  secondly their shots and drinks are pretty good size, they certainly dont cheat you.
author: Janet S.

description: Falls into my "Bars I Like That Are Also Within Walking Distance of My Apartment" category. Very miscellaneous crowd, but I felt welcome.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: this is the place for all of you whiskey lovers.  They have ten million kinds of whiskey with a wide variety of prices.  sort of looks like a dive bar, but not really dive bar priced and once you go in you realize everything is nicer than you would have thought by the sign outside.  Not the best neighborhood but if you are already in the area you might as well stop in.   I've never been there on a weekend night but there is a pool table in the back, mostly chill people, and in my experience, friendly bartenders so i will be back.
author: Jessica H.

description: Excellent chill place in a crazy f*cked up neighborhood, well, I guess it was a Tuesday night.  The bartender gave us an impromptu lesson in whiskey and even did a tasting for us.  Very cool.  Oh, and they even had my favorite Belgian beer on tap, Chimay.  Only reason not 5 stars, the smoking.
author: erin c.

description: This place rules.  I have slowly become a pseudo whiskey drinker given the fact that most of my close friends are so obsessed with it.  The fact that you can smoke indoors is something I appreciated because after all the free whiskey samples I drank down I really needed a smoke.  The bartender was also really cool.  He even gave my friend a free Makers Manhattan so she could taste the difference between one made with Jamison.  A good non-sceney dive bar with good pool payers.
author: Glenda D.

description: Place wasn't bad at all...nice selection, pool table, cutie behind the bar, REAL cutie checking for ID's, but god DAMN is it smokey =(
author: Sean V.

description: I think I drink more whiskey than water.  I was at Whiskey Thieves last night and, for the second time, the bartender (Paul is his name) did a full tasting for me and my friend at like midnight on a Saturday night.  That level of service is completely uncommon these days.  Anyway, I found a new favorite (Michter's Rye) thanks to him.  Great bar - I wish it was closer to where I live.
author: Michael M.

description:
whiskey. smoking. bar. need i say more?

no? well i'm gonna anyway. i told a guy i work with i was going to check out this bar and this is how he described the clientele:

"a bunch of artists and mellow junkies"

i could see that, it works, it works real well for them. this is a perfect goddamn neighborhood bar if only this were my neighborhood. i could see myself going here all the time for a laid back after work beer - nothing fancy, chill, hanging out- but since my actual neighborhood is about 7 miles away and there is NO parking in this neighborhood, yeah, i guess i'll never get back that way again.

just kidding, i think.
author: ms.kiki g.

description: I hate whiskey, but I love whiskey thieves. It is never too crowded so you don't feel like you are being overwhelmed. They have an eclectic and enjoyable selection of beers. Good place to meet up with someone.
author: F B.

description:
drinking, smokng, and a digital jukebox

the dank only makes this place better.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
before i moved to oakland, and quit smoking i was always trying to find a good bar in the tenderloin where i could smoke.  whiskey thieves opened and my prayers were answered.

the drinks were strong, the bartender funny and generous, and the jukebox extensive.  i haven't been there in awhile, but i spent a birthday there a few years ago and had a fabulous time.  now that i smoke occasionally, i couldn't really handle the smoke as much as as i used to.  but if you like whiskey and cigarettes, this is the place for you.
author: Kate W.

description: Smoke em if ya got em!  If you really enjoy smoking while drinking and really don't like those pesky laws regarding doing so in a bar well this is the place for you.  Or if you are looking for a good helping of second hand smoke be sure to stop in.  Of course we can't forget their excellent selection of whiskey and the good service.
author: Derek D.

description: Great place staffed by happy people. they let you smoke and they seem to be genuinely interested in doing a good job (or maybe i was just drunk). Anyway, the bartenders are very good at what they do and they make you feel comfortable and happy to be drinking (no pretentious bs here).
author: ida r.

description: This bar is quite a gem in the generally dull Tenderloin neighborhood.  The drinks are cheap, the bartenders are friendly, and YOU CAN SMOKE INSIDE (because it's owner operated)!  I find this last point especially wonderful due to the fact that I love to smoke when I'm out drinking.  Downside - an Internet jukebox.  I mean, come on, guys.  These are the lamest things to happen to bars since the backless barstool (which Whiskey Thieves has nicely avoided).  Also, the occasional heroin user and/or hooker sometimes gets annoying and depressing.  Other than that a great place to go for a drink if you get stuck in the 'Loin.
author: MonkeyPants S.

description: Pretty impressed by the whiskey selection and the prices. I ordered 3 Manhattans. The first w/ Pikesville was tasty, the second top shelf 3rd from the right was a little too spicy like cinnamon, the third with Bakers it was a tad strong towards the end was good - possibly because i was a little toasty. I don't care that you can smoke in there, it should be an option for bar owners really; but i think there should be better air circulation w/ the HVAC. You know what they have great bartenders and really quality whiskey's and the prices are great - Manhattans made with the selections mentioned above anywhere else would be 10 or 11 dollars. you should go here
author: melissa h.

description: cool bar that reminds me of a "dirtier" amber bar as my friend would say.  first time that i was here, joy division and new order tunes dominated the the atmoshere, and two drunk english gents were totally butchering the song with the wrong lyrics.  Slinte! have another brother.
author: Pickle R.

description: I just moved to the loin from the mission and heard from my friends at hemlock that the w & t was a cool place. so me and my girl strolled over to say hello and we've been going back ever since. cheap drinks, good digital juke and pool ,pinball and computer games at the bar. we have a nice whiskey and a beer a smoke and a laugh with some of the best bar tenders/ owners i have ever met. hang out with yer neighbors and come on down.
author: Don j. c.

description: The biggest selection of whiskeys that I've ever seen.  From all whiskey-making regions.  The whole smoking inside thing is awesome too.  If you're a drunk like me then I advise getting there early. Like 8.  Stay the whole night and they'll start comping drinks like crazy.  You'll probably throw up.  But you'll be laughing and dancing while you're vomiting because you had such a good time.
author: josh b.

description: Goddamn I love a bar where I can smoke cigs! Its oldschool, small and wonderful! I wish I could give it 6 stars
author: Heather G.

description: Whiskey Thieves has an great selection of all types of whiskey. I dealt with two different Bar-keeps, who were very friendly and helpful with selecting a good small batch whiskey. This is the only place I have ever had a PBR pint in a can. The crowd and vibe is great! No over dressed snobs or under dressed bums.The music kicked ass too. A cool Rock n Roll type feel throughout the nite. Cash only probably to avoid the credit card/ATM type peeps.***** I Highly recommend this Bar! *****
author: Xavier M.

description: as the name suggests, whiskey thieves is all about the whiskey.  they have a rotating whiskey/PBR special for $7, my favorite of which is the yamazaki / PBR combo.  the rest of the whiskey selection is top notch and prices are very reasonable.  oh and the jukebox is filled with legit tunes, especially if you are into classic rock, which is really the only music you should be listening to when drinking whiskey.  on top of it all the crowd and bartenders are very friendly.  if you are a true whiskey lover, then this place is hard to beat and definitely my go to bar in the tenderloin area.
author: Scott K.

description:
definitely the reliable hangout and chill bar in my neighbourhood. sometimes full of fun rowdy people, but never too full that you've got to shove your way through to find a clear spot to stand. whiskeys are damn good and with a great selection from cheap to extra f'ing good. good beers on tap. pool table. good jukebox with internet downloady crap for downloading hanson songs. bartenders are definitely cool and know what they're talking about.

EDIT: can't smoke in there anymore thanks to the supes of SF. still a great place, though!!
author: Coffee ..

description: Love it. Great selection of whiskey, my favorite. Bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable...made awesome recommendations. Smoking inside is a plus for me. I've only gone on a Saturday night but the crowd was really mellow, not too crowded.
author: Liz P.

description: very divey bar. dark, saloon-like, regular drunkards, pool table, etc. during happy hour(until 8 i believe), beers on tap are $3. they have some really good ones too, not just your run-of-the-mill bud lights and heineken's. i would assume they have great whiskey here too, but i didnt get to try it. next time for sure. the bartender was cute and very nice. even after the 6 or 7 times we asked for change for a dollar(for pool), she always had a smile on her face. they have one of those new juke-box's with a bunch of new albums too, which is a definite plus. i'll definately be back.
author: Andrew T.

description: Well, this is definitely in the "what do you want/expect" category.  Although even for something in the 'what else would you ask' for category, it seems a bit of a stretch to rate this place as high as the loyal following before me has done so in the rankings.  one of my gf's friend's lives around the corner (hint: i think "lives around the corner" is probalby a theme among the patrons here) and she just loves the place.  i guess i see why.  it's kind of the Cheers-effect.  You know: "You wanna GO....  where everybody knows your naaaammmmmeeee.... "  yeah, kinda like that.  you recognize most of the peeps because they live around the corner and come here continually and you play pool with the same circle of friends that frequent the place.  but, well, other than that.  no reason to come here.  a bit of a divey bar. no frills unless you consider a pool table and an arcade game 'frills.'  Although I will bump it up from 3 to 4 stars purely based on the fact that I could play frogger between beers.  FROGGER!  oh yeah.  and Galaga too.  SCORE.  As long as you don't expect too much and you don't expect the place too renovated or new or clean, and all you expect is a place to hang with a minium of fights and good bartender service with reasonable prices, then this is a good spot.  Expect to meet a lot of people that "live around the corner" as I think few make the drive to come here.
author: dan h.

description: although my eyes hurt after a while from the smoke, there are usually drink specials (last night - pints of celebrity for 2$) and if you decide to go you should check out the girls bathroom.  very interesting mini-tv and sink.  you could watch and wash all day...
author: Karen K.

description: Im ready for a friggin brawl goddamn it. This place BLEEDS brawlin. The only thing that beats this as a brawlin hut is a bloody fightin circle on a Pirate ship named the SS BeatYourFuckingFaceIn healmed by Commandeer McKickTeeth. This place should have sand/sawdust floors, and a juke that plays Johnny Cash. But it was playing Metallica's "...And Justince for All", which wasnt so bad, but i was distracted by free peanuts. What im saying is, i felt compelled to throw the shells on the ground, but i didnt. I behaved. I was a bit aloof for a second, as i was struggling with it. Im sure my guests were all WTFOMFGBBQLOLS...They have a sweet sink in the bathroom too, which i dont think ive ever stated in any form in my life...("Oh Tommy! Sweet sink!" "Thanks Mick! Its new!") Come here with people...otherwise youll end up becoming that guy who wears sunglasses low on his nose to hide his learing upskirt eyes. Especially when you see him at Bob's donuts on a Tuesday morning and he points at you and hes all "Beer and Fernet, right?"
author: Mick F.

description: whiskey thieves is my favorite bar in the 'loin, hands down. reasons for this include great bartenders with heavy hands, an unbelievable selection of (surprise) whiskey, bourbon, scotch, and other brown elixers, generally good music booming out from the jukebox, and a bunch of cool peeps to hang (and sometimes hurl) with. did i mention they enable patrons to rush towards emphasema by allowing smoking in the bar?! after a couple shots of bulliet, i'm ready to inhale my camel non-filters. i'm hesitant to give whiskeys the uber-glowing review it deserves simply because i want to do a little crowd control - namely, keeping lame heads outta the saloon to preserve the laid-back atmosphere - but if you find yourself needing a drink after getting a hand-job at the new century or watching a flick at the amc 1000, head over to whiskey thieves and you won't be disappointed.
author: Veronica Y.

description: whiskey, smoking, pool table, decent tunes and a laid back atmosphere make this the perfect place to go after gallery hopping on Larkin....the drinks were stiff enough for us to start flipping over each other on the dance floor after a while. good times.
author: Parisa M.

description: totally rad! bartender is really nice... he really hooks it up fatty with the drinks! don't play pool though, unless you want to be hustled by pool sharks. fun times!
author: Rikki D.

description: Experiencing post-traumatic break-up disorder? Or maybe just wallowing in the stagnancy of perpetual singlehood? I don't have the cure for either of these pathetic state of affairs but I do have the perfect coping mechanism and that is Whiskey Thieves. San Francisco has too many goddamn "dive" bars and half of them aren't proper dives to speak of. Let's get one thing straight, a dive isn't merely a place that looks drab, has a jukebox and pool table if it's filled with a bunch of poorly dressed bar-goers with a penchant for working class staples like PBR and flannel. That's just dressing the part and it's tantamount to the post-college, young professional crowd doing their part to blend in at Matrix. And while both demographics would be quick to confront the other with disdain, I would argue that we consider both to be branches of the same tree. So if you agree, let's like, cut the cliched verbal assault against said tree and head over to Whiskey Thieves where basically you're not going to run into a bunch of the same morons you caught making out last week. Not that the types of people lurking here aren't disposed to some affection but that's the point: you go to a bar to drink. There's something to be said about the therapeutic effects of getting completely obliterated among those that share a similar plight. Plus, if you get wasted and act the fool, well, no one knows you or gives a shit. Ever since I've been of legal drinking age, the incentive for bar-hopping has been in pursuit of the perfect bar that I've romanticized in my head for years--a notion passed down by Hemingway, Fitzgerald and all those drinkers with a writing problem. Well, I haven't yet managed to adequately capture it descriptively but it would at least come down to a kind of sanctuary with an almost transient and ephemeral vibe. Because ultimately, isn't that what we would hope the problems that drive us to drink fundamentally are?
author: Jenn W.

description: wow. i love dive bars. and slowly but surely becoming a TL dive bar lady. drinks are stiff, bartenders are nice and chatty.
author: Krystha B.

description: came in and was immediately choking from all the smoke.  not one person wasnt smoking.  where are we, indiana!?  no thank you.  we left immediately.
author: jing c.

description: whiskey thieves.  the name in itself makes me wanna talk pirate-like and drink a large amount of beer.  anyway, an obscure little dive with an abnormally cool jukebox... that people smoke inside of.  if i liked beer and smoking, this place would probably be at the top of my list...
author: Jill k.

description: i have two wonderful architorture friends who live in the loiniest of the groins and if i ever have the courage for a solo trip to visit them, i must stop here first to get my brave jacket on. which happens quite fast when you down three shots of whiskey and you're a tiny asian girl. they like girls here, especially those that drink whiskey. maybe they're thieves....
author: diana m.

description: this is my local watering hole. i come here at least once a week. always a fun time meeting up with friends here after work, which usually turns into getting hammered and playing pool and spending way too much money downloading songs on their internet jukebox. smoking inside. i usually smoke until my lungs burn. more drinking. then once i've been here for 2 or 3 hours and played all the pool i can possibly handle, i'm usually too drunk to make a smart decision to just call it a night and go home. i usually hop in a cab and continue the drinking festivities in the mission. tomorrow morning = hangover = lots of gatorade and greasey foods = fat. so yeah, i love this place. the bartenders are awesome too. i'll probably swing by here tomorrow night.
author: James J.

description: I had been meaning to get over to the Tenderknob and check this place out for quite some time, and now I'm regretting that I didn't do so sooner.  This is just one of those bars where everything comes together to make for a really great place to hang out.  When you walk in you'll notice right off that quite a few people are smoking.  While I'm not a smoker, it's nice to know there are a few bastions of freedom left in this city, and to be honest some bars just don't feel quite right without being filled with smoke.  The wall behind the bar is filled with an insane selection of whiskey, bourbon, and scotch.  What makes this selection even more impressive is the fact that this place is really laid back, bordering on almost being a dive.  Usually such an impressive selection would come with a rather uptight and shiny atmosphere .  Instead this place is filled with seemingly normal people, contained neither annoying hipsters or marina chodes, and the bar staff were genially nice people that really seemed to know their stuff.  In the back is a pool table, a few tables with booth seating lining the walls, and one of those damned internet jukeboxes (see my rant about these abominations in my review for The Page).  I've been in bars all over this city, but this is probably in my top 3 now.  This would be a great bar even if it weren't for the great whiskey selection, but with that added in it's easily one of the best places to have a drink in town and worthy of my 100th review.
author: Joshua W.

description: i really enjoyed the laid back atmosphere that this place had to offer. a ton of whiskey choices (sadly, i was not participating in whiskey sipping this particular night) and a fair amount of beers on tap, this place has a lot to offer. major bonus is that its not super crowded and there is room to talk, sit, and leer. id definitely hang out here during the weekdays just to have a very chill time.
author: Aly L.

description: i have the hots for the bartender with the deep voice and is gruff and manly in that cowboy/rock and roller way.  he can put his stiff drinks in my drinkhole any day.  raowr.
author: Katherine K.

description: great place to go to to wake up the next morning in bloody sheets not knowing why your body is killing you......maybe that double shot at last call and attempting to ride your bike home wasn't a good idea.....hmmm was that just me???
author: Eric O.

description: Excellent for whiskey drinkers- Enormous selection (I tried Bullet) and rock bottom prices. Some friends took advantage of the $7 beer + shot deal that they had. They do have other liquor as well, but if you're heading to a bar called "Whiskey Thieves," you should be ready to drink whiskey.  Bartender was friendly and prompt. Pool table is always a great addition, but it's in a tight spot, so people sitting at tabled nearby should watch out for pool cues. On the smoking thing:   I would never recommend this place to someone who isn't either a smoker or very tolerant of smoke. I was all of about 15 when the smoking ban was passed, so I've not experienced this before. While it was a treat for me- especially on a cold and rainy SF night- I'm sure it's not everyone's cup of tea. But the deal is that there is clearly a market for this in the City, and applaud Whiskey Thieves for doing it legally (some bars do not) and unapologeticly.
author: Jenni D.

description: the only thing that rivals beer in my affection is whiskey and scotch. the bartenders here know there stuff....i like it better on weekdays though when you can really focus on the boozing.
author: Geetika A.

description: Go for the whiskey, but stay for the whisky...and rye. This'll be the day that you die....
author: Mary G.

description: this place is solid. the bar is well-stocked and staffed by super knowledgeable and (gasp) friendly bartenders. the crowd is refreshingly un-sceney so the vibe is pretty relaxed. if only i still smoked, i'd be in bar heaven.
author: Spiferina P.

description: Inside it looks pretty much like any other dive bar, but the selection of whiskeys is great, the bartenders knowledgeable and the prices quite reasonable.  Go in, tell the bartender a couple of types of whiskeys you like, and they will let you sample several they think you might like.  It was great--tasted a ton of different whiskeys and ordered a few at very reasonable prices.  Even more impressive, they found one my girlfriend liked--the guidepost we gave was "she doesn't like whiskey" and the bartender replied "I actually have a list of whiskeys for women who don't like whiskey".  I was impressed, and I will be back.
author: Michael K.

description: i like places where i can smoke inside.  san francisco nights are cold.  i also like dark places where no one can see how dilated your eyes are.
author: J.R. R.

description: If your looking for a neighborhood bar that is comfortable, with a great jukebox, and a great selection of whisky and Scotch ... this is your place .... even if this isn't your neighborhood.
author: Christopher L.

description: good snacks, good bar for conversation sans the bullshit
author: John M.

description: My best friend smokes, so she was VERY excited for us to check this place out. Plus, it was hiding right under our noses, just 1/2 a block from one of my favorite restaurants, A La Turca. She told me WT has a special air system to deal with the smoke. Didn't really feel that in action, if that big air duct on the ceiling actually works, but it didn't get too smokey while we were there. (Note: I don't care for whiskey much, although it's impressively arranged at WT by country of origin, etc.) What I like about this spot: the bartenders were really friendly and approachable; the atmosphere is laid back, and made for conversing with friends. The music was a great alt-mix, but more importantly, the sound level wasn't blasting. We usually hang at the Hemlock, but the loud n'sloppy drunken antics of the barely-proveable 21+ kids there tend to mar the energy/experience lately. WT is more civilized and neighborhood-ey, so we'll be back, for sure.
author: Matty G.

description: My favorite dive bar in the middle of the Tenderloin. I've spent many a night nursing a drink (or two, or three) with my friends over a game of pool. Yes, I do realize it's in the smack dab in the center of crack-town but then again, it's on the cusp of Van Ness and therefore, offers a quick escape route. But in any regard, it introduced me to Death and Taxes, now a close ranging first compared to all the other deep dark beers. They have a large range of scotch and whiskey (for obvious reasons) and it has been said, if you ask, they will offer you up a taste of each. The bartenders are pretty damn sociable and once they get to know you, welcoming as well. They put their foot down to outrageous action (I should know, believe me) and keep the atmosphere pleasant and cheery, regardless of their dive bar status. It is damn smoky in there but after a while, it becomes second nature, although the next day can leave your clothes smelling rank. Haven't been around as much as I would like lately, as my friends are attempting to quit smoking and the place almost calls for it. But will be back, sooner rather than later.
author: Lydia H.

description: you can smoke inside.  'nuff said.  i'll add: it's just a bar -- drink, shoot pool, shoot the breeze with friends.  decent drink prices.  and, like someone else on here said, there are a few other noteable bars in the area... so include this in a night of barhopping if you're in the area.
author: Beccie F.

description: Bad experience on evening of Friday 10/02/2009. This place is really cool and the bartenders have always been friendly and helpful. The hot young red head woman is really nice and helpful and fun to deal with but her bearded/ball cap wearing male coworker is a dick. I was sitting at the bar with a friend. We'd had maybe three drinks each and some beers. My money--a stack of maybe 12 one dollar bills---was sitting very much near our (the customer's) side of the bar, no where near the bartender's side of things. The money would have looked to anyone, especially an experienced bartender, as the stack from which my friend and I were amassing our change and paying for our drinks. I watched dick-head bearded bartender dude slowly scoop up our money and begin to place it in his tip jar and I say "Uh...that would be mine" so he then plops the stack back down on the bar and with an attitude (note: no apology) says "well then don't leave it on the bar like it's a tip." I told the dude that when I did tip him there'd be no ambiguity and that the cash would be placed near his edge of the bar. For sure, he knew better. He knew he was trying to steal our money. There was no mistaking it. Plus his asshole reaction confirmed it. He was pissed that we caught him out on the attempt. He truly puts the "Thief" in Whiskey Thieves. For the rest of time we were in there, whenever he had to dispose of an empty beer bottle in the trash bin located near where we were sitting, this douche bag bartender made a point of loudly hurling the bottle with a dramatic smash into the bin. I guess a dishonest person doesn't like to be exposed for what he is. Not sure if I will be going back in this place again. Too bad, it WAS a cool bar. P.S. we didnt tip the thief.
author: Matt G.

description: i live in the neighborhood...this bar is ok. the draw factor is you can smoke and drink good whiskey. the down side is you can smoke and the drink prices are steep. over all check it out for the good whiskey selection, then leave or stick around if you can stand the smoke.
author: flashegirl e.
